programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Derby take part in the dinner competition, hoping to secure the £1,000 prize. First to host are engaged couple Nicky and Lee, whose attempt at a `posh' menu fails to impress Richard and Julia, who host on night two. Then, at the third party, Dave and Gemma are convinced their organisation in the kitchen will bag them the jackpot - but a guest's belly dancing threatens to overshadow their efforts.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The Pickwicks staff in London try to secure deals on high-fashion footwear, while in Sheffield, London Road owner Dan takes in a multi-diamond deal from businesswoman `Botox Sue'.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan makes an offer on Susannah's silver tea set, and Ada's large bronze sculpture leaves him stumped. Meanwhile, at Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, owner Charlie finalises deals on an antique writing bureau and a diamond ring.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The house-hunters are in the West Country, where Phil Spencer meets a couple who are looking to put down roots after years of moving around the country because of the husband's job in the RAF. Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp helps a newlywed couple who have £175,000 to spend on their first home. However, a chance encounter with a neighbour over a garden fence takes their search off in an entirely new direction.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps more home-buyers find a balance between town and country, including young couple Ayden and Pete, who are keen to escape the bright lights of Glasgow.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in at Ivanhoe Guest House in Bridlington, where Mick and Gill Jennings hope their simple approach will win the day. But Michael is quick to pick fault.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Clair Sherwood-Parkin hosts the first party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping to impress with a Moroccan-inspired feast. However, one guest causes a stir when she introduces herself as the Queen of Sheba, and Clair's party game unearths some shocking truths about her diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon James Emson hosts the second party in Darlington, Co Durham, and decides to accompany his curry main course with a gruesome contest in which he serves up a selection of eyeballs, tongues and other bits of offal, then challenges his guests to identify which animal they came from. Diner Barry l'Anson also manages to leave the party having achieved a lifetime ambition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barry l'Anson hosts the third dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and hopes his love-themed evening will endear him to his guests. Unfortunately for him Clair Sherwood-Parkin is not impressed and begins doubting the host's masculinity, and vet James Emson is concerned what the dessert will be like. Charlotte Langley finds herself wanting a sick bag before the evening is over, and Eseyoma Sodje steals the show during some cringe-worthy entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charlotte Langley hosts the fourth dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and asks her guests to attend dressed as their favourite red-carpet celebrity, but as the night progresses, she discovers she is not very good at taking criticism and a tense situation threatens to get out of hand.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eseyoma Sodje hosts the final dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping her Nigerian recipes and a hint of glamour will impress her guests. To further improve her chances of bagging the £1,000 prize, she puts on a round of hip-hop karaoke, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr around the tasting table this time are First Dates' Fred Sirieix, food critic Giles Coren, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panel choose between four different brands of smoked salmon, gin and the ready meal favourite lasagne. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test samples milk chocolate, something Brits spend around a billion pounds on each year.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho reveal which chocolates and biscuit brands to avoid when it comes to price. They look at how much it really costs to get a `free' coffee from the nation's biggest chains. The team also investigates travel insurance, and the high cost of West End theatre tickets.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This edition follows the case of a man who was attacked and left unconscious on the floor of a crowded pub for more than 30 minutes, but no-one is prepared to come forward and name the assailant. The next day, detectives from Bedfordshire Police seize CCTV footage from the pub and though they can clearly see the vicious assault, they are unable to easily identify who threw the punches. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the investigation as the officers try to overcome the wall of silence they face.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: New series. The popular 1990s game show returns - after last October's one-off revival as part of Stand Up to Cancer - for a full series, with comedian and film-maker Richard Ayoade stepping into the shoes of previous hosts Richard O'Brien, Edward Tudor Pole and Stephen Merchant. As the Maze Master, he will guide five intrepid celebrities - Ore Oduba, Vicky Pattison, Alex Brooker, Lydia Bright and Louie Spence - through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Future zones, where they play a range of skill, mystery, physical and mental challenges to win the all-important crystals. The more they win, the more time they have in the final test - the Crystal Dome.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First into the studio is 21-year-old Dom from Hampshire, who has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a girl who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Exploring life at Liverpool Women's Hospital through the eyes of male midwife Chris, a former navy trauma medic. Cameras also follow 22-year-old Kiefer, the birthing partner for his girlfriend Sophie. Following life-threatening complications during the birth of their first child, can he hold it together this time?.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces a new challenge when he is called upon to save the life of a buzzard with a broken wing. A couple's beloved labrador turns up at the clinic with badly damaged elbow joints, and a pampered cat that is used to living the good life faces surgery to repair slipping knee-caps.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from south-west London compete for the £1,000 prize, beginning with butchers Roland and Anne. Second host Penny hopes that her organisational skills can help her gain points, but partner Thom's revelation threatens to embarrass her. Fancy-dress enthusiasts Tony and Rebecca host the final evening, with a dessert based on Tower Bridge and a starter resembling a rugby pitch.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, an unusual Harley-Davidson motorbike, an antique flapper purse and a pair of solid gold coins keep Dan and his assistant Ellie busy doing high-end deals. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, staff broker a deal on a fur coat and ring, and a 100-year-old music player.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The property experts head to London, where Phil Spencer helps first-time buyers Jo and Pete, who are looking for a place together in the areas of Archway and Holloway for around £400,000. Meanwhile, in West Hampstead, Kirstie Allsopp seeks out a family home for Tham and Krish that falls into the preferred school-catchment area for their daughter.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps two sets of house hunters, including Rebecca and Gerhard in Bedfordshire, who want to have the great outdoors as their playground, but still be close to town.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees Ross and Kath from The Kilpeck Inn confront Julie and Gerry's low hosting score, and accusations of tit-for-tat game-playing start to fly.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five amateur chefs compete for the £1,000 prize in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and keen basketball player Ken Oputa is the first to host, inviting his guests to turn up in sportswear fancy dress. He hopes his Double Dribble mushrooms and Slam Dunk salmon will prove to be winning ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer Erika Sager hosts the second dinner party of the week on board her boat in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and invites her guests to dress up as pirates. Despite the unconventional setting, her rivals are all impressed by the standard of her food and hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. Ken Oputa tries to make an impression on the female contestants with his romantic poetry, but finds Erika Sager switches her attentions to his rival Jamie Baker.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. After dinner, he entertains his guests with a bucking bronco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples who know exactly what they want and aren't afraid to say it. programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. programme.desc: Mercenary leader Barney Ross is recruited by the CIA to recover a top-secret package, only to come to blows with a rival band of hired guns. Barney swears revenge when the other faction kill his protege, and leads his men on a mission to stop their enemies taking over a former Soviet nuclear facility. Action thriller sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone and Jean-Claude Van Damme. Includes 5 News Update at 11pm.(n)

programme.title: House at the End of the Street
programme.desc: A teenager moves to a new area and discovers a nearby house was the site of a horrifying incident in which a girl murdered her parents before disappearing without trace. She befriends the killer's troubled brother, but starts to worry that he may be hiding a terrifying secret. Horror, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Elisabeth Shue and Max Thieriot.(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Serial killing thrills for Denzel Washington, who plays paralysed forensics expert Lincoln Rhyme, who teams up with fresh-faced cop Angelina Jolie to hunt down the killer. Dark and stylish(n)

programme.title: Sweet Dreams

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Hit comedy set on an American college campus in the early 60s, focusing on the outrageous escapades of the Delta fraternity - a house full of beer-swilling party animals. The college dean wants them out and enlists the help of snobbish students from a rival fraternity, leaving Delta to use all their wit, cunning and downright deviousness to avoid being thrown off campus(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Drama about an unconventional new English teacher and his ultimately questionable impact on an elite Vermont boys' academy. Robin Williams, in a straight role, blows into the stuffy halls of academe like a breath of fresh air, startling colleagues and delighting boys with his disdain for traditional teaching methods and text books. But the seeds of rebellion he sows have far-reaching effects that he never intended(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: A veteran detective called Kimble is forced into going undercover in a kindergarten to capture an elusive criminal. Now he must keep 23 kids under control and retain his cover(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Comedy about conjoined twins whose bond is tested when one of them decides to become an actor in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Paul Walker puts the pedal to the metal in this high-octane sequel to 2001's "The Fast and the Furious." Walker returns as Brian O'Conner, a cop skilled at street racing. This time out, he goes undercover in Miami to take down a drug magnate. The result: relentless action, kinetic street racing and gravity-defying car chases(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: The film begins in 1965, when disc jockey Adrian Cronauer (Robin Williams) is assigned to take over the AFR's Saigon radio broadcasts. In contrast to the dull, by-rote announcers that have preceded him, Cronauer is a bundle of dynamite, heralding each broadcast with a loud "Goooooood morning, Vietnaaaaam," playing whatever records tickle his fancy (even those not officially sanctioned by his hidebound superiors), and indulging in wild flights of improvisational fancy. Cronauer's immediate superior Lt. Hauk (Bruno Kirby), whose own notions of humor are puerile and pathetic, jealously attempts to dethrone Vietnam's favorite rock jock. Fortunately, Cronauer's popularity is such that he enjoys the full protection of the higher-ups. But when Cronauer, after experiencing the horrors of war first-hand, insists upon telling his listeners the truth instead of the official government line, he is instantly replaced by the unfunny Hauk and must struggle to get back on the air(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: LA journalist Steve Lopez begins writing a column about a mentally ill homeless man with a talent for playing the cello. Lopez tries to help improve his life, but finds his new friend's state of mind a stumbling block. Drama(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: After The Shawshank Redemption , director Frank Darabont stayed inside prison for The Green Mile, based on Stephen King's novel. The title refers to the green strip of lino leading from the condemned cell to the electric chair in Coal Mountain Correctional Facility during the 1930s. Tom Hanks is the head guard of Death Row who just wants life for him, his colleagues and the condemned to be nice and easy, but when Michael Clarke Duncan, a man-mountain convicted of murdering two little white girls, arrives, things start to get strange - how can he cure Hanks' urinary infection with a touch, bring a dead pet mouse back to life and cure the warden's wife's cancer? Is he innocent? And what will happen when his moment of execution arrives? In turns moving and dramatic, at nearly three hours, Darabont has the time to breathe life into the characters and the plot in an almost Dickensian way that rewards the viewers' patience(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Edie Falco and Angela Basset head the outstanding ensemble cast in this keenly drawn character study. Set in a northern Florida coastal town, it's the tale of an engaging collection of locals and their reactions to the arrival of real-estate developers who want a piece of their paradise.Timothy Hutton, Bill Cobbs. Written and directed by John Sayles(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: The third entry in the Dirty Harry series. Clint Eastwood is saddled with a female assistant to search for the kidnapped mayor of San Francisco, who's being held hostage by a terrorist group. Tracking them down to a deserted Alcatraz, it's time for Harry to get the trusty Magnum out again in James Fargo's all-action movie(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A futuristic cyborg is sent to present-day Los Angeles to assassinate a woman, who will bear the child who will someday save humanity(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Johnsons set out from California for a family reunion in Missouri. The parents are split up, the kids are arguing - can everyone keep it together for the big day?(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: When meek Eilis Lacey (Saoirse Ronan) emigrates from Ireland to New York City, her heart is soon torn between a magnetic Italian neighbor (Emory Cohen) and a charming lad (Domhnall Gleeson) back home(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Five Oscars went to this enthralling biography of 20th-century icon Howard Hughes. The epic drama details Hughes' glory years from the 1920s to the '40s, when he earned a vast fortune making films and designing planes, while also romancing Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him on a Pacific island(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalise Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Homeland Security agents attempt to shut the author and Beckett out of a car-bombing crime scene. Matters are complicated further when the duo discover the victim, a government whistleblower, has been killed by a military robot. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of an investment analyst whose dealings with a bankrupt company left many clients penniless. Overcoming initial problems with identifying the victim, they pick up on a clue that leads them to the dead man's attorney, who was apparently the last person to see him alive. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the stabbing of a college activist, whose knowledge of a beef supplier's poor sanitary conditions may have led to his death. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Delko is rushed to hospital with potentially fatal gunshot wounds, and Horatio waits anxiously as medics try to revive him, while the rest of the team searches for his assailant. Calleigh and Ryan process the crime scene, and question a security guard who provides them with what appears to be vital information - until further evidence sheds new light on the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy officer scheduled to testify in a forthcoming murder trial goes missing after receiving a threat at the safe house where he was staying, and the deputy district attorney asks the NCIS agents to locate him. One of their few leads is a dead turkey Tony and McGee find in the man's fridge, so they take it to Ducky for an autopsy. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Grace tries to put Will's actions behind her, while he makes big plans for the future. Elsewhere, Justine takes measures to make Seth more comfortable away from the boat, and Olivia is visited by Stan's current wife, who is worried that something is going on between the former couple.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Jack is offered his dream job in Philadelphia, and Olivia's ex-husband Stan reveals his plan to move back to Cedar Cove. Meanwhile, Maryellen investigates John's past by taking a trip to Tacoma, but her prying drives a wedge between them.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a struggling actress in what appears to have been a bungled robbery. When a couple produce a video tape showing the thieves at work, the detectives waste little time in tracking down their suspects. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Two thieves discover the skeletal remains of a woman who was believed to have died in the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Centre. It transpires that a valuable and unusual ring has been stolen from the body, and the team suspects foul play. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Elisabeth Rohm and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates an arson attack that looks like a case of revenge on an ex-lover and her new partner, leading him to meet Yelina. However, as events proceed, he finds himself with no option but to sack a team member whose personal problems are starting to disrupt the inquiry. Drama, starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine dies while saving the life of a foreign defence secretary, who was the target of an assassination attempt. Gibbs and the team are given the task of protecting the politician's daughter while she studies in America, but fail to stop her being kidnapped and ransomed in a bid to prevent her father signing an important treaty. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine's teeth and fingertips are found in a pickpocket's stolen purse, and Ducky discovers he had been tortured on a rack before dying. The agents realise he may have been killed in error, and that the real target was his ex-girlfriend, a skilled player of computer games who unwittingly uncovered a mysterious code. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Sergeant Benson is rescued by the squad following William Lewis's death. However, her strife continues when her actions are investigated by the Internal Affairs department, and head prosecutor Derek Strauss calls for her arrest. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson goes undercover to meet a man suspected of raping three women he met through a speed-dating service. The case takes on a new complexity when the suspect's wife drinks herself into a coma after testifying against him, and he asks for her feeding tube to be turned off - against the wishes of her mother. Guest starring Dean Cain, Veronica Cartwright and Teri Garr.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A pregnant teenager is attacked and loses her baby as a result of the injuries she sustains - but during the team's search for her assailant, it gradually becomes clear that she helped to orchestrate events. Novak and Branch realise her boyfriend was also involved, but disagree over the appropriate action to take against him. Starring Diane Neal and Fred Dalton Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: An American football team's doctor is murdered in his home while his wife is tied up in their bedroom, after arguing with a player who blamed him for a drug scandal. Goren and Eames investigate the couple's preacher, who teaches an extremely tolerant and forgiving approach to adultery, and a member of the church's congregation who evades their questioning. Crime drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team are called to a deaf family's home, where a woman has been shot and killed - a case that brings up memories of Lindsay's troubled past. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny investigate the murder of a promising figure-skater who has been found dead at the ice rink - and come to suspect she was not the intended target. Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Anna Belknap star.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: After turning up at Lindsay's house with his hands covered in blood, Justin claims he was in a bar fight - but Lindsay is certain there is more to the story. She decides to confide in Hank, but is swept aside as he focuses on an investigation into the death of a man who had links to the higher echelons of the criminal fraternity. Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe and Sophia Bush.(n)

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: When a 15-year-old escort disappears at a downtown hotel, Maria Cortez goes undercover to infiltrate an underage prostitution ring masterminded by two brothers. However, as the detective gets close to one of the men, she is forced to confront her traumatic past. Canadian crime drama, starring Lisa Marcos.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The body of a woman who hacked a law office for a specific file is discovered in a water tank. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a woman killed in a fall from her art studio rooftop. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A private investigator's murder draws Briscoe and Green toward a case of corruption in a baseball league - where the manager will do anything to ensure his team wins. They learn the victim had unearthed a scandal in which an ineligible player was being fielded in every game - and his discovery may have led to his death. Detective drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman is killed at a charity event and suspicion falls on his wife, whose blood matches a sample found at the crime scene. However, it later transpires that she has a twin sister - and the victim had a double of his own. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Adam Rodriguez and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the murder of a marine during a cruise. They discover he came from a famous and wealthy family but had turned his back on a life of privilege to join the military, and after the death of his father had inherited a large part of his business. His decision to change his will may have pushed one of his relatives to kill him to keep the firm in their control. Crime drama, guest-starring Diane Neal (Law & Order: Special Victims Unit).(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.sub-title: Cedar Cove: Christmas Special: A New Life.
programme.desc: Jack and Olivia face up to life apart, although neither are filled with good cheer as Christmas approaches. A pregnant young woman arrives in town and is given a job at Moon's coffee shop and the opportunity to play her guitar, while Peggy's nosiness leads her to a picture that may depict the father of the unborn child. Meanwhile, Seth returns with a business plan, and Justine becomes determined to find John after visiting a gallery in Seattle and uncovering a photograph taken by him.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Jack returns to Cedar Cove, and realises he is missing out when he learns his son Eric is to become a father. Cliff and Grace's feelings for each other grow warmer, while Maryellen tries to convince John to face up to his past after tracking him down to a hotel in Seattle. Seth and Justine's plans to open a restaurant go up in smoke, Justine is approached by a federal agent on the trail of Warren, and alarm bells ring for Eric and Shelly in the delivery room.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green are assigned to investigate the execution-style killing of a prominent businessman, and discover his wife was having an affair. However, further evidence emerges, suggesting a different motive - and an unlikely conspirator. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green look into the shooting of defence lawyer Vance Grodie, who had just won an acquittal for a suspected cop killer. Their investigations reveal a link to a network of conservative extremists, and the discovery leads the case into an examination of civil rights. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A suspected carjacker is murdered and the team believes he may have been involved in drug smuggling. To complicate matters, evidence suggests that Ryan, who is now working for local TV, could have inadvertently led the killer to his victim, a possibility that further distances him from his former colleagues. Crime drama, starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents learn one of their former investigative assistants has been murdered, and had been selling information about how to rob a warehouse full of valuable possessions belonging to a woman convicted of fraud. As the case proceeds, Tony becomes infatuated with the new leader of another team, who apparently returns his feelings. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homicide police hand the case of a retired marine colonel found murdered with an axe over to NCIS when they are unable to solve the case, despite all the circumstantial evidence pointing to the deceased's drug-addicted son. They discover the suspect's mother went missing two years previously and Ziva suggests he may have killed more than one parent, while the family's neighbour is revealed to also have had a motive for wanting the man dead. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a high-speed chase, Morales and Jaruszalski investigate the murder of a city worker found dead in the vehicle - but there is no sign of the driver.(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a conspiracy theory, becoming violently delusional as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit properties in Birkenhead, Paisley and Madeley Heath, Staffordshire, talking to their new owners about their plans.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha gets frustrated when she is not allowed to leave work to visit her mother, while Heston is banned from seeing bride-to-be Ruhma. PC Watson checks out a protest.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is in the Cotswolds on an unusual house-hunting mission with a couple whose £900,000 budget needs to fund two separate homes under one roof.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three more items from the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with master craftsman Jay Blades revamping a discarded chair and artisan Norman Wilkinson using old floorboards to transform a chest of drawers.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Tim Weeks collect unwanted items from a neighbourhood in Matson, Gloucester, raising funds for a popular local man who suffers from narcolepsy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Johnny does his best to make things up with Derek and encourages him to reveal what is really going on. Robbie tells Sonia she needs to be honest with Bex if she expects her daughter to move in with her, Patrick feels guilty about Dot's accident, and Mick starts to relax as he makes the final preparations for Linda's return home.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officer Alan Pennington heads to a scrap yard to recover money owed to a mechanic who was sold a faulty engine, and Sheriffs Lawrence and Kev face a very tricky problem as they deal with the repossession of a garage business. Meanwhile, Sheriffs Tommy and Craig take a High Court Writ to one of Britain's biggest and most famous companies - but how will they track down the right person who can make the payment that the company's former employee is owed?.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team helps a couple whose 24-year-old son Ryan has been living in hospital for the last five years, as they renovate the downstairs of their three-bedroom house in Bristol so he can move back home. The house needs a downstairs extension with all the bespoke care provision that Ryan will need, including physio space, a wet-room, a family area and the ability to access the entire ground floor, and if the family doesn't get this work done, Ryan will remain in hospital 50 miles away.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Hastings, East Sussex, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley are live asking for help with unsolved cases, and there is a profile of the team that police the world-famous Isle of Man TT races.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander explores a one-bedroom flat in London about to be auctioned, while Martin Roberts looks at a two-bedroom terrace house for sale in Abertillery in south Wales, and catches up with a project to renovate a pair of semi-detached properties in Walderslade in Kent.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: Paramedic Ste Hill attends a man suffering from a suspected anxiety attack, while colleague Mike Duggan assists a homeless man who has fallen in the street. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Police officers make a gruesome discovery on a farm where burglars have allowed wild boars to escape, and a thief robbing a supermarket invites her friends for a free shop.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Leominster in Herefordshire, where experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant advise two teams competing to win the greater profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: It is the day of the wedding, but doubts remain as to whether Shak will turn up, while Rob has to deal with the arrest of Bren.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton goes property hunting in North Devon for a couple whose search for a country home on a £325,000 budget has so far fallen short. He also learns about a unique local pigment, known as Bideford Black, and enjoys the artistic freedom of painting on the beach.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells three things about to be dumped at a tip in Witley, Surrey, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of the items. Items include some discarded oak and an old armchair. Narrated by Arthur Smith.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Danny Sebastian help locals in Monks Kirby, Warwickshire, by arranging a sale to raise funds for Carl Hodgetts, who has spina bifida. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Sally Philips host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker hosts the light-hearted quiz, with sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, wheelchair tennis star Jordanne Whiley, Olympic bronze medal-winning judoka Sally Conway and goalkeeper Mark Schwarzer joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Carters are all ready for Linda's surprise birthday party - but with Mick on edge and the unexpected arrival of Fi, it looks like things may not go as smoothly as they hope. Johnny enlists Patrick's support to persuade Derek not to leave Walford. Bex is torn when Sonia insists she moves into the new flat with her and Robbie - angering Martin in the process.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: Arthur attempts to build bridges with a surprising figure from his past. Comedy, starring Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear and featuring Graham Fellows in his guise as John Shuttleworth.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career, recalling his first appearance on Irish television and discussing a school reunion. There's trouble down at the Phoenix Club when Stars in Your Eyes gets cancelled, while Elton John makes a guest appearance.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes needs someone to look after Grandad so she can treat herself to a much-needed holiday - but with private nursing homes being so expensive, it seems her only option is to convince the health visitor he has lost his marbles. Rory and Dino move in for a couple of weeks, and the matriarch is soon spitting feathers when the latter begins taking over the house, and her late husband gets in touch from beyond the grave with some ominous news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham rounds off his current run with a compilation of highlights from the series. Clips feature Michael Caine, Morgan Freeman, Warren Beatty, Goldie Hawn, Patrick Stewart, Nicole Kidman, Ian McKellen, Tom Cruise, Judi Dench, Diane Keaton, Michael Fassbender and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.title: Entrapment
programme.desc: An elusive professional art thief suspected of stealing a priceless painting is pursued by an insurance agent. However, instead of bringing the criminal to book, she teams up with him to plot the robbery of a lifetime - although neither is sure the other can be trusted. Crime thriller, starring Sean Connery, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Ving Rhames, Will Patton and Maury Chaykin.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Weather presenter Carol Kirkwood joins Brian Conley to revisit favourite TV memories, including Starsky and Hutch, The Liver Birds and Play School.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: The BASICS team treat two-year-old Ashanti, who has suffered a fit, while paramedic Kathryn Davies attends to a 15-year-old with Crohn's disease.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Kingston upon Thames, south west London, two teams of mothers and sons are challenged to pick up bargains at an antiques fair. Antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss are on hand to guide them towards turning a profit at auction as presenter Tim Wonnacott observes proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton presents the second semi-final, which begins with the teams having to create six perfectly uniform Buche Entremet, a large log-shaped sharing dessert, with multiple layers of flavours and textures. At the same time, they have to prepare all the elements needed for a live table-plated dessert, a three-minute piece of gastronomic theatre in front of judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin. In the final challenge, the teams are tasked to make a centrepiece made entirely from sugar, with one group making their way to the grand final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day four from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the quarter-finals. Eventual champion Dominika Cibulkova recorded a hard-fought 4-6, 7-6, 6-3 victory over top seed Agnieszka Radwanska at this stage last year, and British number one Johanna Konta's run continued with a 7-6, 6-4 win against Ekaterina Makarova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team visits Normanby Hall in Lincolnshire, where experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley value items brought in by the public, including traditional Troika and tribal artefacts, one of which brings a surprise for the owners at auction. Presenter Paul Martin returns to the city of Lincoln to visit the cathedral, and gets a unique look at a stained-glass window.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Steve Leonard and Miranda Krestovnikoff for another test of wildlife knowledge, hosted by Kate Humble.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin visit an island in Norway, spending two days in a house built on a footprint of just 100 square metres. In Spain, the pair head to a home built into a steep cliff face overlooking the Mediterranean, featuring a cantilevered terrace offering maximum sea views and a swimming pool as well as an unusual tiled roof. After viewing a house in New Zealand crafted from two separate wooden cladded structures, the duo explore a home in Canada inspired by two ships in dry dock, designed to peer over the coast, allowing the sea to pass underneath.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Final Dessert.
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the finalists to get a dish in contention for the banquet and the chefs are going all out as they serve their dessert course. Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort are joined by tennis player Annabel Croft to judge the puddings, before selecting the final menu to be served at Wimbledon.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dawn of the Driverless Car.
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Who Should We Let In? Ian Hislop on the First Great Immigration Row
programme.desc: As Brexit Britain prepares to draw up new rules on who is welcome in the UK, Ian Hislop explores the decades from the Victorian era to the First World War, when modern Britain introduced its first peacetime restrictions on immigration. Until then, the Victorians had an open door to foreigners, but rising numbers in the late 19th-century triggered a fierce disagreement over who should be allowed in, mirroring the ongoing modern-day debate.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ireland: The Edge of the World
programme.desc: Part one of two. Natural history cinematographer Colin Stafford-Johnson begins a journey along Ireland's Atlantic coast by exploring the ancient ruins and wildlife of the Skellig Rocks in the south west, where early Christian monks built a monastery 1,500 years ago. He then ventures to the deserted Blasket Islands to witness vast numbers of seals coming ashore to fight, mate and moult during winter. Moving inland, Colin heads to the nation's highest mountain range in search of the last surviving herd of red deer, before setting off back to the coast on the trail of humpback whales en route to Clew Bay.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Joseph, who plays viper-tongued Dorien in Birds of a Feather, joins Brian Conley to discuss how a production of David Copperfield and June Whitfield's comedy timing inspired her stage and television careers.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: The MERIT mobile trauma team is called into action to deal with a man who has been stabbed and hit in the head with a sledgehammer.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams of firefighters select antiques to take to auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire, helped by experts Richard Madley and Catherine Southon. Tim Wonnacott presents.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Mike Reid, Selin Kiazim and Tom Kemble continue the battle for a place at the Taste of Summer banquet, celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. This time, the three chefs are tasked to create a main course, with each choosing to use aspects of traditional summer barbecues as their inspiration.(n)

programme.title: Big Love
programme.desc: The story of James and Phil Lusted from north Wales, who have a rare form of dwarfism and are 3ft 7 and 3ft respectively. The film reveals how they managed to find love with women of average height, with both of them engaged to be married. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day five from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the semi-finals. British number one Johanna Konta's fine run came to an end at this stage last year when she was defeated 6-7, 6-3, 6-3 by the Czech Republic's Karolina Pliskova. In the other last-four match, Puerto Rican qualifier Monica Puig was overwhelmed 6-2, 6-1 by Dominika Cibulkova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents the show from Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, with experts James Lewis and Elizabeth Talbot. Featuring a local sculptor who craves giant spiders.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts as team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Vianet Djenguet and Steve Backshall for another test of wildlife knowledge. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin explore unusual homes built underground. In Greece, they view a house hidden beneath the landscape that still boasts stunning sea views. In the Swiss Alps, they visit a house made so invisible it has to be accessed via a tunnel. Next it's over to New Zealand's South Island to a house built underground to soften its impact on the landscape as well as withstand the threat of earthquakes, before the pair inspect a Dutch house created by deep excavation, which features a huge, light-filled open-plan living space. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Banquet.
programme.desc: The grand finale sees the winning chefs cook their dishes at the Taste of Summer banquet. On arriving at Wimbledon, they are greeted by Master of Ceremonies Dan Bloxham who gives them an exclusive behind-the-scenes tour. Once in the kitchen, they have to prepare the winning menu for guests including players and champions as well as those other workers who help deliver the Championships. From Tim Henman to Judy Murray, the guests are all expecting perfection. Determined to do their best, the chefs are feeling the pressure as judges Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort monitor their efforts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: Direct from Pinewood Studios, the comedian tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's news - with guests including Sara Pascoe and Katherine Ryan prepared to take the Scotsman to task over his claims.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Jo Whiley and Mark Radcliffe introduce highlights from the festival at Worthy Farm in Somerset, including a reminder of some of the big performances, stories and moments from the weekend's events.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present the February 2 show, featuring Musical Youth, Queen, Matthew Wilder, Fiction Factory, Thomas Dolby, Thompson Twins, Juan Martin and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis charts the stories of Britain's castles and their roles in the country's history, art and literature. He begins by looking at the structure's first appearance during Norman rule in 1066, and then at the siege of Kenilworth Castle 200 years later, revealing how it was initially used as an instrument of invasion, but soon became a weapon with which unruly barons challenged the crown. He also visits Tintagel Castle in Cornwall, the place where King Arthur is said to have been conceived.(n)

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: The documentary examining the wildlife of the east Asian country focuses on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island and a place totally unlike the rest of the country. Every year it swings from a bitter Siberian winter into the warmth of a Mediterranean-like summer, with the thaw revealing a landscape changed beyond all recognition. It takes hardy animals and tough people with real ingenuity to survive in this ever-changing place. Michelle Dockery narrates. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Frank Skinner on Muhammad Ali
programme.desc: The comedian learns more about his hero, boxing icon Muhammad Ali, by visiting key locations and people in his life. In Ali's hometown of Louisville, Kentucky, he meets the boxer's brother Rahman and his former wife Khalilah, who was alongside him in the turbulent years when he was banned from the ring for refusing to fight in Vietnam. Frank also meets a bare-knuckle boxer from Oxfordshire who became one of Ali's dearest friends, and visits the Pennsylvania training compound where Ali and his team prepared for the Rumble in the Jungle. With contributions from Nicola Adams, Larry Holmes and Ali's business manager Gene Kilroy.(n)

programme.title: Boxing at the Movies: Kings of the Ring
programme.desc: Writer and critic Danny Leigh explores the elemental drama of the boxing movie, examining how each generation's fight films have reflected their times and been used to address powerful themes such as redemption, race and corruption. He asks why film-makers from Stanley Kubrick to Martin Scorsese have depicted tales of the ring, and interviews former undisputed world heavyweight champion Lennox Lewis, Rocky director John G Avildsen and Thelma Schoonmaker, editor of Raging Bull.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present the February 2 show, featuring Musical Youth, Queen, Matthew Wilder, Fiction Factory, Thomas Dolby, Thompson Twins, Juan Martin and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: A Brief History of Graffiti
programme.desc: Dr Richard Clay presents a comprehensive outline of the 30,000-year history of graffiti, from the prehistoric cave-paintings found in Burgundy, France, through to the gladiatorial fan-worship of Roman Lyon, and the messages left on the walls of the German Reichstag by Russian troops in 1945. Along the way, he unpicks the many reasons that compel people to scribble and scratch lasting mementos to their successors into any available surface, and reveals how these rudimentary memorials have developed into a legitimate art-form.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis charts the stories of Britain's castles and their roles in the country's history, art and literature. He begins by looking at the structure's first appearance during Norman rule in 1066, and then at the siege of Kenilworth Castle 200 years later, revealing how it was initially used as an instrument of invasion, but soon became a weapon with which unruly barons challenged the crown. He also visits Tintagel Castle in Cornwall, the place where King Arthur is said to have been conceived.(n)

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: The documentary examining the wildlife of the east Asian country focuses on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island and a place totally unlike the rest of the country. Every year it swings from a bitter Siberian winter into the warmth of a Mediterranean-like summer, with the thaw revealing a landscape changed beyond all recognition. It takes hardy animals and tough people with real ingenuity to survive in this ever-changing place. Michelle Dockery narrates. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell introduce performances by Slade, Thompson Twins, Style Council, Shannon, Queen and Nena.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Roxy Music perform Ladytron in 1972.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: A 1979 edition of the old-time music hall programme, chaired by Leonard Sachs. John Inman, Rita Morris, the Balladiers, John Wade, Julie Royce, Duo Barodies, Raymond Bowers and members of The Players' Theatre, London, entertain an audience from the stage of the Leeds City Varieties. First shown on March 1, 1979.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Compilation of archive performances, comprising tracks by the Moody Blues, the Faces and David Bowie, originally recorded for It's Lulu, Sounds for Saturday and The Old Grey Whistle Test.(n)

programme.title: Tom Jones' 1950s: The Decade That Made Me
programme.desc: Tom Jones fronts the first of four retrospective documentaries in which celebrated musicians look back at the decades that defined them. For Tom, that decade is the 1950s, the era following the austerity of the Second World War that saw a boom in popular culture, which swept aside the old order and ushered in a new era of entertainment. The veteran singer provides a first-hand guide to his formative years in a small mining community in south Wales, revealing how he - much like many people of his generation - turned to TV, movies, radio and music to find a voice for himself. Revisiting Treforest and Pontypridd, where he spent his childhood and teenage years, Tom recalls his joy when rationing finally ended, his encounter with American GIs stationed near his home, and the arrival of rock `n' roll and the `Teddy Boys'. Includes contributions by writers Joan Bakewell, Katherine Whitehorn and Michele Hanson, and historians Alwyn Turner, Dr Martin Johnes, Tony Russell and Francis Beckett.(n)

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.(n)

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the BBC
programme.desc: A tribute to the renowned London-born pop diva, featuring BBC archive footage of some of Dusty's most famous performances from 1961 to 1995. The programme also offers a chance to relive the singer's story, from her folk beginnings with the Springfields, through to her Motown homage years and her collaboration with Pet Shop Boys in the late 1980s. programme.title: Confessions of a Shopaholic
programme.desc: Based upon Sophie Kinsella's series of books, 'Confessions of a Shopaholic' is the story of a typical Manhattan girl who struggles with her debilitating obsession over shopping. Rebecca Bloomwood's buying sprees have buried her in immense debt. She dreams about landing a job at her favorite fashion magazine as a way to transform her addiction into something that could really benefit her professionally. But unintentionally (and ironically) she ends up being hired as an advice columnist at a financial magazine. Rebecca's innovative comparisons and unconventional metaphors for economics grant her critical acclaim. Meanwhile, as she teeters on the brink of bankruptcy, she gradually begins to reassess her priorities in life(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace

programme.desc: Datshiane Navanayagam investigates just how hard it can be to get a British passport and the real impact that the lack of one has on many people's lives. She reveals there are already 120,000 children and young people born or raised in the UK who think that they are British, but who will not automatically gain citizenship, and she also examines the huge costs involved in applying for citizenship and how the Home Office assesses claims, and asks whether Brexit will make the situation worse.(n)
