programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady's revival of the dating game show continues, as a former member of the Royal Air Force embarks on a mission to find her very own Prince Charming, and a male swimwear model takes his pick of three single ladies. Plus, Paul catches up with last week's matches to discover whether their first dates were a success.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Bad TV
programme.sub-title: Best of Bad TV: Most Shocking Ever.
programme.desc: A romp through the most inappropriate, outrageous, ill-conceived and downright cringe-inducing moments that made it to air. Clips include steamy choreography courtesy of Pan's People, exercising for the elderly with fitness guru Sue Becker, an unlikely combination mix of daytime television and alcohol in a Christmas edition of Pebble Mill at One and programmes intended to shock such as Eurotrash, The Word and The Girlie Show. Contributors include Katy Puckrick, Sarah Cawood, Christine Hamilton, Paul Morley, Mark Dolan, David Quantick, Nina Myskow and Zoe Lyons.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat, as well as reactions to the latest eviction. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal has the latest developments and invites his studio audience and celebrity guests to discuss how the Big Brother housemates are getting on.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Ripping, fact-based profile in chutzpah about the U.S. congressman who, in the 1980s, used his influence to supply Afghan fighters with money and arms in their battle against Soviet occupiers(n)

programme.title: How High
programme.desc: A pair of real-life multi-platinum rap artists star in this genial substance abuse comedy recalling the pro-marijuana work of Cheech and Chong and such films as Half Baked (1998). Silas (Method Man) and Jamal (Redman) are buddies who enjoy smoking voluminous amounts of the illegal plant. They end up in the possession of some magical weed that enhances their brainpower during college entrance exams, thus enabling them to enter that esteemed institution of learning, Harvard University. Once firmly ensconced in the halls of academia, however, the pals run out of their supernatural supply and are forced to get creative in the pursuit of an Ivy League degree. Included in their narcotic-addled plans: smoking the bones of dead president John Quincy Adams. Produced by Danny DeVito's Jersey Films, How High (2001) co-stars Obba Babatunde, Fred Willard, and Hector Elizondo(n)

programme.title: On Time
programme.desc: A woman who is running late for a job interview is forced to make a tough decision. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood directs and stars in this compelling tale of the unlikely friendship that develops between a bigoted Korean War veteran and an Asian teen who, under threat from some gangbangers, tries to steal his car: a cherry 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the nerve-shredding third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, an ex-cop who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law). After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Tyre-squealing action as a cop (the late Paul Walker) goes undercover to infiltrate Vin Diesel's street racing gang. Contains strong language/violence/flashing images(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to World War II, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle station she inherited(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: This horror from director William Friedkin stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a conspiracy theory, becoming violently delusional as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film, but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: In this spooky and surreal chiller, an American movie producer (Anastasia Hille) searching for her birth parents inherits a house in Russia that holds dark and dangerous secrets from her past. Directed by Nacho Cerda(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen traveling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: In the wake of the detonation of a 'dirty bomb' in LA and under the instruction of a public service announcement, Brad barricades himself within his home. With his wife Lexi on her way to work, he desperately tries to call her in an attempt to find out if she is safe and well. As time elapses and his worse fear looks set to manifest, Lexi appears outside the family home..(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Ben Affleck dons the mask of the blind lawyer-turned-superhero to battle Kingpin and Bullseye in this dark and sexy adaptation of the Marvel comic. Jennifer Garner heats things up as the leather-clad Elektra. Acclaimed Hong Kong fight choreographer Cheung-Yan Yuen handles the dizzying action scenes(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Horror-Thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: In a 1950s-era alternate universe where domesticated zombies play a functional role in society by delivering the milk, carrying the mail, and even helping out with household chores, one boy is about to find out just how big of a personal responsibility "pet" ownership truly is. When the Earth passed through a cloud of space dust and the dead arose from their graves to devour the flesh of the living, it first seemed that all hope for humanity was lost. Society's rapid slide into chaos, however, was soon halted when scientists at a company called ZomCom created a special collar that turned the rampaging animated corpses docile. Now, thanks to ZomCom, everything is under control -- or is it? Timmy Robinson (K'Sun Ray) isn't quite convinced. Quiet and withdrawn, the skeptical young boy spends so much time locked away in his room that he's almost become invisible around the household. His mother Helen (Carrie-Anne Moss) has recently purchased a zombie to help keep things tidy around the house though, and when the creature attempts to engage the curious youngster in a game of catch, a friendship is forged between boy and zombie that finds the amiable gut-muncher nicknamed Fido (Billy Connolly) practically becoming a part of the family. Things take a turn for the worse however, when Fido's collar malfunctions and Timmy's neighbors begin dying in droves. When ZomCom's top zombie control specialist Mr. Bottoms (Henry Czerny) moves in across the street from Timmy, the increasingly complicated situation threatens to place a serious stumbling block in the path of human-zombie relations(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas, Teresa, and the rest of the Gladers prepare for phase two of their maze trials after narrowly escaping the first test in this young-adult dystopian sequel(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In the future, criminals are arrested before they have even committed their crime, thanks to the forecasting of 'pre-cogs'. Detective John Anderton thinks the system is perfect... until he's arrested. Brilliant sci-fi thriller based on a story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: When a young girl begins acting strangely, her mother seeks out a priest, who is convinced the child is possessed by a demon(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Hardboiled detective Max Payne obsessively hunts the murderer who killed his wife and child(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A stolen painting and a crooked land deal intertwines the destinies of a Russian mobster, a London gangster and a junkie punk rocker in writer-director Guy Ritchie's stylish caper film(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him on a Pacific island(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA. Things begin to get sticky when the cross-dressing trio get stranded in a small town governed by a homophobic sheriff, but with some fashion tips here and some glitter there, they win the locals over(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Stupid Spoiled Whore Video Playset. Paris Hilton opens a store in South Park, completely corrupting the town's girls in the process, with only Wendy upholding her morals(n)

programme.desc: Pee. High levels of pee in the pool cause a disaster which ruins the day for the boys, Kyle especially. Cartman's xenophobia comes to the fore yet again(n)

programme.sub-title: Two Days Before the Day After Tomorrow

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: East Bowl/West Bowl Rap. Sketches include college-football all-stars from the East/West bowl; a tale of two mobsters; and valet-parking attendants discussing Batman(n)

programme.desc: 3 Buttholes. In the series 3 finale, Amy dates a guy with a British accent; and watches hookups get thwarted(n)

programme.desc: Paid Programming(n)

programme.desc: Paid Programming(n)

programme.title: Cold Plasma Sub-D by Nicholas Perricone, M.D.
programme.desc: Does your neck make you look years older? Look dramatically younger with a visibly firmer, smoother, sexier neck! Courtney Thorne-Smith unveils Cold Plasma Sub-D by Perricone MD. Buy it and get Dr. Perricone's Blue Plasma "un-peel" for FREE!(n)

programme.title: PiYo Craze!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Own Personal Hell. Elliot gets upset with J.D. when he doesn't defend her, Carla resorts to trickery, and Dr. Cox is stuck caring for one of Dr. Kelso's old, miserable, and demanding friends(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Extra Mile. Turk and Carla attempt to eliminate all the stress in their lives to improve their chances of conceiving, but Turk has to compete for a surgical resident spot and Carla loses Dr Kelso's VIP patient. Meanwhile, Elliot showers her new boyfriend Keith with stupid gifts(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Bright Idea. J.D. and Turk find out that Carla is pregnant before she does, and J.D. convinces Turk to tell the entire staff in order to surprise her. Big mistake!(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Chopped Liver. J.D. swaps his night off so he can hang out more with Turk, who is sad to lose his Turk Night. Jordan forces Dr. Cox on a double date with Elliot and Keith - oh dear!(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My New Suit. J.D.'s brother Dan (Tom Cavanagh) pays a surprise visit, during which he's disappointed to learn that Elliot isn't into him like J.D. had suggested. Elsewhere, Turk slips up when he confides to J.D. the top-secret baby names Carla has chosen; and Dr. Kelso sticks Dr. Cox with the highly undesirable job of assisting Ted. Sam Lloyd. Jordan: Christa Miller. Doug: Johnny Kastl. Keith: Travis Schuldt(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: His Story IV. A look at the world according to Kelso, who befriends an Iraq War veteran (Michael Weston) being treated at Sacred Heart. The soldier sparks political bickering among the staffers as they divide along party lines and end up neglecting the patient as they continue to argue. Meanwhile, J.D. looks for an apartment(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: That '70s Finale. In the series finale, Kelso (Ashton Kutcher) returns on New Year's Eve 1979 to celebrate, while Red and Kitty rethink their plans to move to Florida(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: That '70s Pilot. In the series premiere, Eric gets the family's old station wagon in time to drive the gang to a concert in Milwaukee, a forbidden journey(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's Birthday. Kitty makes it pretty obvious that she is planning Eric's birthday party despite Eric refusing to have one(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Streaking. Gerald Ford is coming to Point Place on a whistle-stop tour and plans are being made for the big day(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Battle of the Sexists. After Donna beats Eric at basketball, she's criticised for bruising his ego, while Eric is chastised for losing to a girl(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's Burger Job. Eric's new job is getting in the way of his social life(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Keg. Eric (Topher Grace) is in hog heaven when he finds an abandoned beer keg while skipping school. Locating a deserted house, Eric plans a party for his buddies, with a cover charge of two dollars per person. All he needs now is a beer tap -- and a means of escaping his parents. Meanwhile, Eric's dad, Red (Kurtwood Smith), is marshaling troops to reclaim his wayward son. Former Brady Bunch co-star Eve Plumb makes a guest appearance(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: That Disco Episode. A disco throws the group into disarray as the dancers and non-dancers take sides(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Drive-in. Donna wants Kelso and Jackie along as company, but Eric doesn't when they make their first trip to the drive-in; and Red and Kitty have their first encounter with a salad bar(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Training Day. Malory orders Archer to train Cyril as a field agent. Archer, however, sees an opportunity to punish Cyril for stealing Lana from him. Elsewhere, Carol and Pam hack into the personal health files of ISIS staff(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Diversity Hire. Casualties in the field mean that ISIS is forced to hire a new agent. However, Archer and Lara grow suspicious of the new recruit(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Killing Utne. Malory hosts a dinner party for the UN Intelligence chairman (voice of Jeffrey Tambor) to get a contract for ISIS, but assassins are out to kill him. Voice of Mannfred: Rene Auberjonois(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Futurestock. Fry blindly supports Planet Express's new CEO, a slick talker from Fry's time who emphasises image as he takes on their biggest rival(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: A Leela of Her Own. Leela sees herself as a female pioneer when she's signed as a Major League pitcher, but she's really there as a novelty act, as she beans every batter she faces. Hank Aaron and Bob Uecker have cameos. Tom Kenny, Maurice LaMarche, Katey Sagal(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: 30% Iron Chef. Aspiring to become a great cook, Bender is coached by a legend before competing against a vaunted TV chef who initially ignored him(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Where No Fan Has Gone Before
programme.desc: Where No Fan Has Gone Before. Guest voices include William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, George Takei, Walter Koenig and Nichelle Nichols(n)

programme.title: Futurama

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Molly returns from holiday determined to put the sad demise of Hector behind her and look to the future. programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Conclusion. After another night undercover on the streets, Mickey learns a second down-and-out has been murdered. The fears of the homeless community are underlined when Mickey's informant is badly beaten and suspicion falls on property developer Greg Simm (guest star Ralph Ineson), who has form for fraud and deception. It emerges the suspect had trouble with squatters holding up work on a development site, but evidence against him is hard to find. A bigger shock for Mickey is the news his new friend Nicola is in the frame for the murder.(n)

programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.(n)

programme.title: Easy A
programme.desc: Will Gluck's intelligent and hilarious high school comedy stars Emma Stone in an outstanding lead performance. Olive Penderghast is something of an 'also ran' in her year at school, so when she spies the opportunity to make herself look a little more interesting and mature she jumps at it and tells a friend that she's lost her virginity to a college boy. However, what was supposed to be a confidential white lie becomes public, and soon she has the cachet of unprecedented notoriety around the entire school. But it's what happens next that's really interesting. Enjoying the glare of attention (despite the brickbats some of her more prudish classmates hurl), she not only sets out to build on her newfound rep as a scarlet woman, she also subverts the moment to help some of the school's more picked-upon students. The film references a host of teen movies, as well as American novelist Nathaniel Hawthorne's 1850 work The Scarlet Letter, but ultimately it's the quality of Stone's acting, allied to a very funny script, that makes this such an enjoyable watch(n)

programme.title: Sharks of the Coral Canyon
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the hunting behaviour of sharks, including footage of nighttime hunting, as well as the link they share with coral reefs.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Broadcaster Clare Balding and vet Steve Leonard travel the world to watch vets perform innovative life-saving operations on a variety of wild animals. This first edition features a baby panda called Zhu Xia in south-west China that needs an MRI scan, and rescued gorilla Shufai in Cameroon, who was shot by poachers when he was a baby. Plus, a manta ray on the Japanese island of Okinawa that needs an ultra-sound scan to determine if it's pregnant, and a four-ton elephant in Laos with a gunshot wound.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: As Giles Clark's adopted tiger cubs begin to grow into their maturity, the time arrives for them to leave his home and return to Australia Zoo. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of power in the animal kingdom, revealing how dominant creatures have the best access to food and water, and are also the most attractive to the opposite sex. An orphaned young chimp tries to climb the social ladder, but his troop is ruled by big, aggressive males and his first attempt to join them ends in a beating. A meerkat society will only allow newcomers in if they know how to deal with a venomous snake. And the only way to occupy the top spot in a meadow of kangaroos is to beat the ruling male in a boxing match - but few have challenged the current incumbent, who stands at 8ft. Will any animal dare take him on? David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Sharks of the Coral Canyon
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the hunting behaviour of sharks, including footage of nighttime hunting, as well as the link they share with coral reefs.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: David McGuire sets out to move a group of sharks to a new home, and activist Alex Yee goes undercover to try and expose the dark secrets around the trade of turtle eggs.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: An incoming storm and a recent death threaten to derail a planning mountain-climbing event on Mount Kinabalu.(n)

programme.title: Great White Matrix
programme.desc: Navy diver and shark attack survivor Paul De Gelder and cameraman Andy Casagrande document the mysteries of modern shark science, including the drivers of predatory behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to South Africa to join a veterinary team trying to help a rhino called Thandi who was attacked by poachers for her horn. For the first time, a plastic surgeon will attempt a skin graft on the animal to heal the wound. She also visits the rainforest of Borneo to follow the story of an orangutan who needs cataracts removing from her eyes so that she can be released back into the wild. Elsewhere, vet Steve Leonard takes a trip to Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo, where the latest technology is being used to help chimpanzees with heart disease. He also visits the South African city of Pretoria, where a Cape fur seal requires a CT scan to identify the root cause of her illness, and a giraffe urgently needs to be anaesthetised to treat a leg injury.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.sub-title: Tigers About the House - What Happened Next.
programme.desc: First of a two-part programme catching up with zookeeper Giles Clark and the Sumatran tiger cubs he was hand-rearing in his home in the suburbs of Queensland. Spot and Stripe are approaching their first birthdays and Giles has his hands full guiding them from adolescence into adulthood, while Spot faces uncertainty about his eyesight and his relationship with Stripe. The Clarks also make a big decision to safeguard the cub's wild cousins, with Giles, his wife Kerri and son Kynan embarking on a road trip through Indonesia with the aim of helping to protect endangered species.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal.(n)

programme.title: Great White Matrix
programme.desc: Navy diver and shark attack survivor Paul De Gelder and cameraman Andy Casagrande document the mysteries of modern shark science, including the drivers of predatory behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: Researchers set out on a treacherous hike, hoping to capture video footage of the Danum Valley's most elusive wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: The documentary exploring life on the remote island of Borneo continues, as the children of the Bajau Laut reluctantly attend the new school built for them.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House

The Clarks also make a big decision to safeguard the cub's wild cousins, with Giles, his wife Kerri and son Kynan embarking on a road trip through Indonesia with the aim of helping to protect endangered species.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to South Africa to join a veterinary team trying to help a rhino called Thandi who was attacked by poachers for her horn. For the first time, a plastic surgeon will attempt a skin graft on the animal to heal the wound. She also visits the rainforest of Borneo to follow the story of an orangutan who needs cataracts removing from her eyes so that she can be released back into the wild. Elsewhere, vet Steve Leonard takes a trip to Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo, where the latest technology is being used to help chimpanzees with heart disease. He also visits the South African city of Pretoria, where a Cape fur seal requires a CT scan to identify the root cause of her illness, and a giraffe urgently needs to be anaesthetised to treat a leg injury.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to Japan where she visits inventor and vet Dr Keiichi Ueda. The vet has dedicated the past 12 years of his career to helping a dolphin called Fuji who has no tail as a result of a bacterial infection and he is hoping that a new prosthetic tail will enable her to swim properly again. Steve Leonard heads to the rainforest of Laos, where Edinburgh Zoo vet Romain Pizzi is undertaking keyhole surgery on a endangered moon bear called Champa who suffers from excess fluid on her brain. Steve then visits Florida where reptile specialist Doug Mader is using the latest technology to save Martha, an alligator with a badly blocked gut. Clare and Steve also follow the stories of a Galapagos tortoise with a mystery illness, a five-ton elephant suffering from an infected tusk and a tiger that keeps having nose bleeds.(n)

programme.title: The Hitcher
programme.desc: Horror remake about a young couple who become embroiled in a bloody battle of wits with the psychotic hitchhiker they stop to pick up on their way home for spring break. The hitcher is a brutal serial killer who decides to set up the young driver as the fall guy for a string of horrific murders as part of a macabre game of cat and mouse(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: The Farrelly Brothers all-out comedy film stars Jim Carrey as Charlie, a nice-guy cop who's had a hard life - on his wedding day, his wife ran off with the wedding car driver, leaving him to bring up triplets. Fifteen years later, he's had enough of the jokes and jibes and out bursts Hank, a bad cop character who will bust anyone for anything. But then he and his long-suffering girlfriend Irene come across cop corruption and, pursued by the evil Lt Gerke, must go on the run, and need both Charlie and Hank's special skills to keep them alive(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A former biker and drug dealer single-handedly takes on the nefarious Lord's Resistance Army in a noble bid to save young Sudanese refugees from a life of violence and suffering. Inspired by actual events, Marc Forster's Machine Gun Preacher stars Gerard Butler as Sam Childers, a tough-as-nails biker whose heart shatters upon witnessing the harrowing plight of children in Sudan. Determined that no child shall be enslaved by the brutal Lord's Resistance Army, Childers turns to God for inspiration, and establishes an orphanage for wounded kids and child soldiers. When the Lord's Resistance Army refuses to stand down, Childers organizes a militia to protect the children. In helping to give the orphans of war-torn Sudan a better future, the former outlaw begins to find new meaning in his own life as well(n)

programme.title: A Simple Plan
programme.desc: Thriller about three men who find millions of dollars in the wreck of a single-engine plane buried in the deep snow of a Minnesota winter. Deciding to see whether the money is missed come the spring thaw - when the plane will be found - they try to sit on their secret without arousing the suspicions of family and neighbours or cracking under the unexpected pressures that gradually accrue(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan named Ella is treated cruelly by her stepmother and stepsisters, who force her to do menial chores. However, her life changes forever when she meets a prince(n)

programme.title: Bad Company
programme.desc: When a CIA is murdered during a mission, the fellow officer recruits his twin brother to complete the operation(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's terrifying masterpiece about a coastal community plagued by a killer shark. With the summer tourist season at hand, the mayor is keen to keep the first attack hushed up. But when an expert claims that the attacks are the work of a giant Great White, there is only one solution - to kill the monster fish before it can feed again. Based on Peter Benchley's best-seller, three sequels and numerous imitators followed. Steven Spielberg(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Just when Mrs. Brody thought it was safe, a great white shark follows her to the Bahamas after killing her son(n)

programme.desc: Action-adventure starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a former special agent who is reluctantly pulled back into duty when his daughter is kidnapped by a gang of right-wing extremists(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Dale Denton, a process server with a weed fixation, witnesses a murder and turns to his dealer, Saul, for support. The murderer is actually Saul's main drug supplier, and because of Saul's access to some extremely rare high-grade pot (called Pineapple Express) the two are quickly tracked down and put on the run(n)

programme.desc: The FBI's Mulder and Scully seek the truth about conspiracies, extraterrestrials and killer black ooze in this so-so adaptation of the TV series(n)

programme.desc: When a group of white supremacists seize control of a quiet Midwestern town, a fearless martial arts master and a righteous sheriff team up to take back the streets(n)

programme.title: Hancock
programme.desc: Hancock is a sarcastic, hard-living and misunderstood superhero who has fallen out of favor with the public. When Hancock grudgingly agrees to an extreme makeover from idealistic publicist Ray Embrey, his life and reputation rise from the ashes and all seems right again, until he meets a woman with similar powers to his and the key to his secret past(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: Rousing action drama in which the US Navy's elite commando force, the SEALS (sea, air, land), are sent to rescue hostages from a ship in the Middle East. A plot is uncovered to sell stolen Stinger missiles to terrorists, but when the SEALS launch a surprise attack in Syria to retrieve the armaments, the terrorists become more aggressive and the mission more dangerous, culminating in an invasion of besieged Beirut(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: After an assassination attempt on the American President (William Hurt) during a meeting of world leaders in Salamanca, a secret service agent attempts to piece together who was responsible. The event is replayed through the eyes of six different witnesses, each time from their individual perspective. Each time a little more is revealed about what really happened, with a new twist just when you think you have it all figured out(n)

programme.title: Hancock
programme.desc: Hancock is a sarcastic, hard-living and misunderstood superhero who has fallen out of favor with the public. When Hancock grudgingly agrees to an extreme makeover from idealistic publicist Ray Embrey, his life and reputation rise from the ashes and all seems right again, until he meets a woman with similar powers to his and the key to his secret past(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: A glossy high-tech, futuristic sci-fi exterior does little to conceal the fact that this gory actioner is little more than a cliche-ridden prison movie--a movie that found tremendous popularity internationally. Set amidst an overpopulated, oppressed future U.S., it centers on the struggles of a defiant young couple who decide to have a second baby after the first dies. Unfortunately, the law states that each woman can only have one child. It is irrelevant whether the child survives or not. The couple attempts to make it safely out of the country, but they are captured and sentenced to spend three decades in the dreaded, corporate-owned Fortress, a grim place where lasers replace iron bars and inmates are controlled via radio-operated pain-inflicting intestinal devices. Incorrigible prisoners are forced to have their identities erased by a "mind wipe" machine. The prison is controlled by a sadistic cyborg warden and a robot army. The warden wants to make the woman's baby into a cyborg too. The warden also finds the wife very attractive. Meanwhile the husband begins making friends with his cellmate in hopes of finding a way to disable the surveillance system in time to save his wife and somehow escape(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: Rousing action drama in which the US Navy's elite commando force, the SEALS (sea, air, land), are sent to rescue hostages from a ship in the Middle East. A plot is uncovered to sell stolen Stinger missiles to terrorists, but when the SEALS launch a surprise attack in Syria to retrieve the armaments, the terrorists become more aggressive and the mission more dangerous, culminating in an invasion of besieged Beirut(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: An American soldier becomes involved in an illegal Hong Kong kickboxing competition, where combatants fight to the death for the world championship. This extremely violent, low-budget action drama was reportedly based on the true story of martial arts champ Frank Dux(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: New York City, 1863. Before there was the city we know today, a city of wealth, power and infinite dreams, New York was a very different place, a fledgling young city where the desire for a better life raged in crime-ridden streets. Here, as the Nations own survival was being tested by the ongoing Civil War, a vast and dangerous underworld was born in the streets. These were the gangs of New York, as portrayed in Herbert Asburys classic book, whose racketeering, bootlegging, swindling, gambling and murdering would become legendary - and whose culture of corruption threatened the very survival of Americas working people. In the young, unfinished City, it was a time of ruthlessness, intolerance and fear. But it was also a time of extraordinary bravery, as those pushed to the edge fought for the freedom of future generations. Director Martin Scorsese sets this epic drama in this defining moment in New York City history, an era whose conflicts helped define who and what makes an American. Against the backdrop of this brave new world unfolds a story about a fatherless sons search for honor, vengeance and the courage to remake his life(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: The commissioner revokes Adrian's licence in exasperation at his latest blunder, leaving Stottlemeyer struggling to solve the case of a woman killed with a chainsaw. Finding herself without an employer, Sharona goes to work as a nurse - but later manages to get her old job back and help catch the killer. Guest starring Saverio Guerra (Becker).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane deals with two failed robberies, one resulting in the murder of a repair shop owner, and the other involving a former suspect the consultant hired to break into LaRoche's home. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects that a state prison inmate is to blame for the murder of a guard who was stabbed to death outside a jewellery shop, and Rigsby decides to find out what his criminal father knows about the killing. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nate takes on a case linked to his son's death, and leads the team into their riskiest con to date. He knows the mission puts the squad's reputations - and health - on the line. He relates to Ellen the brief to steal `The Black Book', a record of all illegal transactions made by bankers and wealthy businessmen that led to the financial crisis of 2008.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick as Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson, who heads the Priority Murder Squad, a special unit of the LAPD handling sensitive, high-profile murders. In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Members of the Northern California Symphony Orchestra come under suspicion when a violinist is murdered, and Cho encounters a young pickpocket. Crime drama, starring Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part series finale, a bank robber's suicide bombing outside a petrol station convenience shop leaves Jane suspecting there is more to the case than meets the eye. The incident is linked to the discovery of the body of a torture victim, and it transpires he was related to Hightower - who appears to be the target of serial killer Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. When one of the prime suspects is given an alibi by the FBI, she discovers he is a pawn in a larger investigation. The detective also struggles with her feelings for Fritz.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan resolves to spend more father-son time with Steve, and the pair start bowling together, a pass-time at which the awkward teen proves to be quite gifted.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Carter go to Africa to get their money back after they are swindled in an e-mail scam, while Brian pursues Meg's friend Patty.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Jeff and Hayley announce they would like to have a baby, and Stan takes the prospect of becoming a grandfather badly. Meanwhile, Steve plans to become a responsible uncle.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Cleveland and Quagmire help throw Jesus an important birthday party after running into the Son of God at the Quahog Mall. Animation following the misadventures of America's disaster-prone Griffin family, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian goes to collect Stewie from Lois's parents' house in Palm Springs - but the duo lose their plane tickets in an airport bar, and find themselves with no choice but to stow away on board a train back to Quahog. Meanwhile, the Griffins try to spice up their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A new drug craze hits town, prompting Peter to assume the guise of new student Lando Griffin to eradicate the problem at Meg's school, where he extols the virtues of clean living with a song-and-dance routine inspired by Grease. Animated adventure, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: Neon Joe, Werewolf Hunter
programme.desc: Neon Joe and Vance battle Daggart and The Cube in a final showdown that will decide whether will succumb to a race of all powerful superwerewolves.(n)

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Morty convinces Rick to buy him a sexy robot, but it only ends in trouble. Guest starring Claudia Black and Richard Christy.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan's friends are shocked to learn that he has never killed anyone, despite his high-octane career. Roger and the guys rally round to help him get off the mark.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine becomes a surrogate mother for gay neighbours Terry and Greg, prompting an outraged Stan to kidnap the baby once she is born. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger think Klaus is out to get them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: While testing a top-secret CIA surveillance device, Stan is shocked to discover his neighbours do not think very highly of him. In retaliation he evicts the whole neighbourhood so he can live free from criticism - but soon realises his mistake.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan gets into trouble for delivering contaminated cattle to a slaughterhouse as part of a plan to make a man out of Steve. Meanwhile, Roger causes trouble between Francine and Hayley.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A meeting with a successful former schoolmate inspires Peter to make his mark on the world, while Chris is discovered by an influential art dealer and goes to New York to pursue a career as a painter. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Mila Kunis and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg grows tired of being constantly embarrassed by the rest of her family and secretly books them to appear on Diane Simmons' daytime talk show - where they prove so popular that the network offers them their own reality TV series. Animated comedy, with the voice of Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine's adoptive parents visit for an unannounced holiday with the family, and Stan becomes angry when they refuse to fall in with his `man of the house' attitude. Steve tries to impress a girl at school by living to the extreme.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Over-Correction. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily are shocked when they discover that Marshall's mother has started a new romantic chapter in her life with an unexpected partner(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Final Page, Part One. Ted invites his old university professor, who insisted he would never make it as an architect, to the grand opening of the GNB building. When the professor snubs Ted by returning the invitation, saying he doesn't know who he is, Ted goes back to the campus to confront him. He takes the gang along for old time's sake, but while there Lily and Marshall run into an old acquaintance they would rather avoid. Seth Green and Peter Gallagher guest star(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Final Page, Part Two. Barney tells Ted that he plans to propose to Patrice and swears him to secrecy. This puts Ted in a difficult position, as he feels that he should tell Robin what's happening, so he asks her to be his date to the gala opening of the GNB building, intending to confide in her at the event. Marshall and Lily have their first night away together since the birth of baby Marvin and are determined not to waste a minute of their special evening, but as time passes they become anxious about their son(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Band or DJ?. When Robin learns that Barney failed to ask her father's permission before proposing, she insists that he gets Robin Sr's approval as soon as possible. programme.title: Taken 3
programme.desc: Former covert operative Bryan Mills (Liam Neeson) must race to protect his daughter while tracking down the criminals who framed him for killing his wife in the adrenaline -fueled third chapter of the Taken saga. Bryan and his ex-wife Lenore (Famke Janssen) are taking their first tentative steps toward reconciliation when she is viciously murdered, and he is targeted as the prime suspect. Now, with the CIA, FBI, and every cop in the country hot on his trail, Bryan realizes that it's only a matter of time before his enemies get to his daughter Kim (Maggie Grace), too. Determined to keep her alive at any cost, he realizes that his only hope for saving her is to clear his name before he is captured. But while Bryan does possess the "particular set of skills" to stay one step ahead of the men who want his entire family dead, proving that he's innocent of murder and seeing that the real killers face justice might be the last thing he ever does(n)

Martin Scorsese's family adventure, starring Asa Butterfield, Chloe Grace Moretz and Ben Kingsley.(n)

Western spoof, directed by and starring Seth MacFarlane, with Charlize Theron and Liam Neeson.(n)

Horror remake, starring Liam Neeson, Lili Taylor, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Owen Wilson.(n)

Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

However, bold French Resistance forces vow to stop them, enlisting the help of a train inspector along the way. Second World War adventure, starring Burt Lancaster, Paul Scofield, Jeanne Moreau and Michel Simon.(n)

Incensed by what he reads, he embarks on a crusade to discover the prison commandant's new identity and expose his crimes to the world. In the process, the trail leads him to a secret organisation that helped Nazi SS officers escape justice. Thriller, based on Frederick Forsyth's novel, starring Jon Voight, Derek Jacobi and siblings Maria and Maximilian Schell.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe head to Pembrokeshire to visit a local fish-shop owner who hopes to impress them with her own crab-cake recipe. The chefs then set up their kitchen to prepare a savoury supper at the Nevern Agricultural and Horticultural Show, where they have to win over judge Elonwy James.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: Tiffani Thiessen serves guests Dave Foley and Naomi Priestley retro dishes like tangy pickled turnips, a cheesy patty melt, disco fries, and a boozy chocolate hazelnut milkshake.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: Tiffani dishes up her family-style favourites, including homemade spaghetti and meatballs, a spinach salad with crispy pancetta, and a decadent chocolate cake.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul looks back over his incredible journey into the baking heritage of some of the world's most famous cities, and showcases some favourite recipes inspired by his visits.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul looks back over his incredible journey into the baking of the world's cities, and showcases some of the most inspirational characters that he met on his travels.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond treats her family to a frontier-style Tex-Mex feast, featuring chicken and beef fajitas, after they spend the day working cattle.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking, including a chicken taco for lunch and ideas for doctoring up dressing.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe embark on the second day of their culinary road trip. They reach Trawden in Lancashire and pull up beside the ruins of Wycoller Hall with one of their prize cheesecakes to compete in a garden show against some of the best local bakers. Along the way, they catch up with butcher Joseph Mellin to sample a delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Kirkby Lonsdale, Cumbria, where they enter the `dessert in a wine glass' category at the Lunesdale Country Show. They also meet gamekeeper Richard Wolfenden, who attends to the red grouse on Fourstones Moor, and he provides them with the luxury ingredient of freshly caught game.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: Hosts Camila Alves and Eddie Jackson meet eight young barbecue cooks, and the competition kicks off with each cooking his or her famous flavours for chicken and a signature side.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul looks back over his incredible journey into the baking of the world's cities, and showcases some of his favourite moments spent with the bakers themselves.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there. In the first edition, Paul heads to New York, where he discovers how doughnuts have been recreated with fresh, innovative flavours. Plus, he meets internet sensation Jim Lahey, who has invented a new, simple way of baking bread at home.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits two Lone Star chefs who create the craziest cooking contraptions and prove that everything is bigger in Texas.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is on the hunt for lip-smacking ribs, and he found two places where the racks of meat stack up to perfection.(n)

programme.title: Jamie & Jimmy's Food Fight Club
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty open a seaside cafe in Southend, Essex, inviting friends, locals and celebrity guests to try their culinary creations. The pair also hit the road, travelling around Europe to find out how the nation's favourite dishes stack up against foreign alternatives. In the first edition, comedian and chat-show host Alan Carr drops by the cafe, and Jamie and Jimmy compare a range of British and French cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owner of Athena Mediterranean Cuisine in Brooklyn where its dwindling customer base is beginning to suggest that business and family are a bad mix.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team investigate rumours of a misbehaving restaurant mascot at Zippy's Giant Burgers in Seattle.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owners of a Seattle restaurant ask the team to investigate rumours that members of his staff are offering haunted tours of the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: In Luton Airport No One Can Hear You Scream.
programme.desc: The Meldrews return from an overseas holiday to find yet another disaster awaiting them - their home has been demolished. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: How Not to Cry at Weddings.
programme.desc: In the final episode of Roy Clarke's long-running comedy, everyone prepares for the wedding - prompting Howard and Pearl to look back at their relationship. Meanwhile, Alvin flirts with Stella, Toby tries to smarten himself up in a bid to win back Monica, and Clegg worries he has forgotten something important.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Lair of the Cat Creature.
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil's belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy throws a party while his parents are attending the Chartered Accountants' Ball. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright invents a saint's day as a pretext for checking the pockets of a foreign visitor suspected of shoplifting. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: In Luton Airport No One Can Hear You Scream.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg.
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream.
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom finds himself suffering a bad back during harvest time, which leaves Barbara to do all the work on her own - a situation made worse by the terrible weather. Sitcom, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy seems reluctant to reveal any information about her new boyfriend, Mark refuses to talk about why his wife has thrown him out, and Dermot lies to his fiancee's parents about his job - all of which makes Agnes feel her family is becoming too secretive. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark thinks a funeral is the perfect place to take Sophie on a date, while Jeremy gets friendly with a group of Christians, leading the pair to conclude that death and illness are the keys to a successful romance.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain

programme.sub-title: The Black Adder: Born to Be King.

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: The TV licence inspector calls round so Bridget puts the house into lockdown. How long can they hold out with the supply of cigarettes running out? Comedy, starring Jennifer Zamparelli and Bernard O'Shea.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Comedy about two zoo keepers at dilapidated tourist attraction Bob Fossil's Zoo-niverse. Howard agrees to take on a deadly kangaroo in a boxing match. Vince decides they need intensive training, some jazzy tracksuits and the aid of his bare-knuckle fighter uncle to turn Howard into a champion, but when all that fails it's up to Naboo the local mystic to save the day.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including salmon, cuttlefish, chocolate and aubergine. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics Jay Rayner, Tracey MacLeod and Charles Campion - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants test their bread-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking a flavoured loaf, they face the task of baking focaccia. A display basket featuring 24 rolls forms the final leg of the challenge, before judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the third heat. The six hopefuls begin by dishing up their calling card, a single plate of food that represents who they are, followed by the invention test, in which they prepare a dish in one hour from a choice of two sets of surprise ingredients. After two cooks are sent home, things get serious, with the rest preparing dinner for 2006 MasterChef winner Peter Bayless, 2012 finalist Andrew Kojima and 2011 semi-finalist Jackie Kearney. It's then down to the judges to decide who will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore what Britons ate during wartime and discover how some of the UK's favourite dishes have evolved from rationing. The duo also meet army cooks to find out what troops on the front line eat today, and prepare rabbit stew and carrot cake.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi's culinary journey takes him to Istanbul, where he tastes fish from the waters of the Bosphorus, shops for vegetables and samples the street food. Inspired by what he sees, he prepares Turkish pizza topped with spicy beef, pine nuts and a crunchy salad by baking it in a traditional stone oven, before cooking a casserole bursting with prawns, squid, tomatoes and cheese. He also visits a factory to help make baklava, one of the country's most popular desserts.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal delves into the history of iconic British dishes to find inspiration for a culinary salute, beginning with a three-course pie banquet. For his starter, he learns about the `surprise' pies of the 17th century and a dwarf boy who would jump out of one at a grand feast. Heston prepares a gala pie made up of beetroot and horseradish ice-cream in place of meat, with goat's cheese panna cotta, saffron and bacon, and the main course is a gothic affair inspired by Sweeney Todd. The chef also sets out to make the lightest ever mash with an attempt to change the molecular structure of a potato. The dinner is served to a select group of pie-makers 100ft in the air over the East End of London.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

It's then down to the judges to decide who will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins, while there's a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to America's west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigella's home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Provence.
programme.desc: Tarte Tatin is one of the dishes on the menu as the chef celebrates French cuisine in rural Provence. She also pays a visit to a cheese-maker.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including crab meat, sea purslane, mango, ricotta and coconut. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw heads to the Tohuku region, where he goes to sea with fishermen who caught a record-breaking tuna and meets the soy-sauce maker who saved many of his staff from the 2011 tsunami.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking their own interpretation of a classic, the contestants face the task of baking brandy snaps. Preparing a display of macaroons forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six more amateur cooks compete for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final. They prepare a plate of food that represents who they are as their calling card and choose one box of ingredients - either sweet or savoury - to rustle up a surprise dish in the invention test - after John Torode demonstrates what he would do with the same produce. Two are then sent home, leaving the remaining four to serve dinner for 2007 and 2012 MasterChef champions Steven Wallis and Shelina Permalloo respectively, as well as 2006 finalist Dean Edwards, before John and Gregg Wallace decide who has made it through.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britain's fondness for picnics, preparing an alfresco lunch at Beaufort Polo Club in the Cotswolds. They also discover how the habit of outdoor dining in summer evolved into its current form, celebrate snacks such as Cornish pasties and Scotch eggs, and bake a Dundee cake.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi's culinary journey takes him to Tunisia, where he dines on fresh fish, discovers the national obsession with fiery harissa paste and samples spicy merguez sausages. He begins with a visit to an open-air restaurant set in an idyllic cove and managed by a hermit, and serves grilled red mullet with a lemon and celery salad, before travelling to a seaside cafe, where he tries making brik - a fried pastry snack containing soft egg and tuna.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein Tastes the Blues
programme.desc: The chef charts how the culinary and musical traditions of the Mississippi Delta have intertwined throughout history, and learns about the people who live along the river's banks. He visits restaurants, bars and famous concert venues to trace the stories of the region's colonial past and the famous musicians who shaped the evolution of the blues.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.(n)

programme.desc: The chef explores what makes Scandinavian food so popular as she visits Stockholm, where she is inspired by traditional Swedish baking.(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: New troubles have arisen in Gotham City. First, there's new super villain in town: Mr. Freeze a former doctor whose blood is laced with cryogenic liquid, causing him to be cold in look and feeling who plans to freeze Gotham until he gets the money needed to finish finding the cure for a mysterious disease that has stricken his wife. Second, Poison Ivy a villainess with luscious lips full of venom, has arrived in Gotham with her hulking servant, Bane, with plans to team up with Freeze and prepare the way for genetically enhanced plants. Third, Ivy has caused a rift between the partnership of the Dark Knight and the Boy Wonder. And finally, Alfred Batman's trusted butler, has developed the same disease that Freeze's wife has. It is in this time of need that a new partner, Batgirl steps forward to help the two rid the city of evil once more(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner (Nate Parker). Turner is ordered by his master (Armie Hammer) to tour a number of local plantations, delivering sermons to the other slaves that will urge them against violence and any thoughts of rebellion. However, he is so appalled and sickened by the horrors he sees during his travels that he is eventually moved to fight back against the evils of slavery. Aja Naomi King and Gabrielle Union co-star. Parker wrote, directed, and stars in The Birth of a Nation, which won the Grand Jury Prize at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Insecure as F**k. Two black women who are best friends navigate the pitfalls of their personal and professional lives in south Los Angeles in this comedy, which begins with Issa wondering if her relationship with her boyfriend is still worth the effort, while Molly's success as an attorney barely masks her dissatisfaction with her romantic prospects(n)

programme.desc: Server Error. In the Series 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner (Nate Parker). programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teen daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: Fall to Grace
programme.desc: In 2004, New Jersey governor Jim McGreevey was struggling with his public image and the political fallout from allegations of sexual harassment when he resigned from office after making a surprising revelation -- that he was "a Gay American" who was in a relationship with a man despite being married to a woman. McGreevey's marriage and political career were soon over, and outside of the public eye, he began following a different path. In the documentary Fall To Grace, filmmaker Alexandra Pelosi offers a look into the life of Jim McGreevey eight years after he left office: a man of renewed religious faith, he serves as a counselor, mentor, and spiritual advisor to the female prisoners at the Hudson County Correctional Center, and is in a stable, long-term relationship with another man as he strives to serve those who need help rather than chasing power and privilege. Fall Into Grace was produced for the HBO premium cable network, and received its world premiere at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: The world's most enigmatic superhero, Batman, resurfaces for another Gotham City adventure. This time, he's pitted against villainous freak The Penguin and the devious, sexually-charged Catwoman , both of whom are out for revenge against the world which has treated them so cruelly and which Batman seems to represent. These new foes prove more than a match for him both on a professional and a personal level, especially when The Penguin enlists the help of industrialist Max Shreck to run for mayor of Gotham, and when Catwoman takes a sadomasochistic shine to her rubber-suited nemesis(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Action-packed sequel to the sci-fi comedy about a top secret government task force set up to deal with unruly extraterrestrials. An MIB agent turns to his former mentor to help him save the world from a rampaging, shape-shifting alien who has taken on the outward appearance of a sexy lingerie model(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad (very bad) alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is their main impediment to their gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the Sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero..(n)
