programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In this science fiction thriller, child psychiatrist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed a technique that allows her to travel through the minds of her patients. When Stargher (Vincent D'Onofrio), a multiple murderer who methodically drowns his victims and performs bizarre rituals with their bodies, falls into a coma, FBI agent Peter Novak (Vince Vaughn) asks Deane to enter the killer's psyche, in the hope of finding a missing girl whom Stargher has kidnapped; if she's not soon found, in all likelihood she'll die in his torture cell. However, once Deane enters the bizarre world of Stargher's mind, she finds getting out to be a very difficult matter. The Cell was the first feature from director Tarsem, who previously made award-winning commercials and music videos, including the video for R.E.M.'s "Losing My Religion." The supporting cast includes Catherine Sutherland, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Dylan Baker, and Pruitt Taylor Vince(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: Gruesome thriller starring Christian Bale (Batman) as successful Wall Street broker, Patrick Bateman, as he indulges his penchant for hedonistic living and terrible violence(n)

programme.title: 3 1/2 Minutes, Ten Bullets
programme.desc: A stunning documentary look at the 2012 murder of unarmed black teenager Jordan Davis at a Florida gas station, and the political and social fervor that surrounded the ensuing criminal case. On trial for the murder is white middle-aged Michael Dunn, who shot Davis after taking issue with the loud rap music coming from the car Davis occupied with his friends. Florida's controversial "Stand Your Ground" law is examined in full in this emotional documentary, which has been picked up for distribution by HBO(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: A human and a stork unite to deliver a baby girl to her family. The storks had stopped their baby delivery business since they started working with an e-commerce company in delivering parcels(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: In 1960s South Carolina, a young white girl and her black caregiver are taken in by an eccentric trio of sisters(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Young hustler Charlie Babbitt feels cheated when he is disinherited in favour of his autistic older brother, who he never knew existed. Charlie kidnaps him from the asylum and they head for California, learning much about each other on the way. Hoffman won an Oscar as Best Actor for his role(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: John McClane takes on terrorists targeting government computer systems(n)

programme.title: The Mothman Prophecies
programme.desc: Based on a book by paranormal investigator John Keel, this spooky, X-Files-type supernatural thriller is purportedly based loosely on true events that occurred in the small town of Point Pleasant, WV, in 1966-1967. Richard Gere stars as journalist John Klein, an up-and-coming reporter devastated by the death of his beloved wife Mary (Debra Messing) following a car accident. Mary saw a mysterious vision immediately before the crash, a haunting image of a moth-like creature. Two years later, Klein is driving to an interview with the governor of Virginia when he suddenly finds himself hundreds of miles out of his way in a small town on the West Virginia-Ohio border. He discovers that strange events are occurring there, including sightings of the "mothman," as well as UFOs and bizarre alien-like telephone calls. Klein stays to investigate, despite the protests of skeptical cop Connie Parker (Laura Linney) and the initial hostility of spooked local Gordon (Will Patton). He soon discovers that sightings of the mothman are historical portents of doom and disaster, omens that may foretell a terrible cataclysm about to strike Point Pleasant. The Mothman Prophecies reunites Gere and Linney, who previously starred together in Primal Fear (1996)(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Ronald and Reginald Kray are idential twin gangsters who built an empire of crime in London during the 1950s and 1960s(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner (Nate Parker). Turner is ordered by his master (Armie Hammer) to tour a number of local plantations, delivering sermons to the other slaves that will urge them against violence and any thoughts of rebellion. However, he is so appalled and sickened by the horrors he sees during his travels that he is eventually moved to fight back against the evils of slavery. Aja Naomi King and Gabrielle Union co-star. Parker wrote, directed, and stars in The Birth of a Nation, which won the Grand Jury Prize at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. Eager to take over the world and remake it in his own image, Apocalypse recruits mutants to act as his powerful "Four Horsemen" -- among them is the tortured Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who believes humanity might be a lost cause after a personal tragedy. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death in this pulse-pounding sequel. At the same time, he must evade the government forces hot on his trail(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Adaptation of journalist Diana B. Henriques' account of financier Bernie Madoff's orchestration of one of the largest frauds in U.S. history that led to financial ruin for thousands of investors and, in the process, his own family's destruction(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In this science fiction thriller, child psychiatrist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed a technique that allows her to travel through the minds of her patients. When Stargher (Vincent D'Onofrio), a multiple murderer who methodically drowns his victims and performs bizarre rituals with their bodies, falls into a coma, FBI agent Peter Novak (Vince Vaughn) asks Deane to enter the killer's psyche, in the hope of finding a missing girl whom Stargher has kidnapped; if she's not soon found, in all likelihood she'll die in his torture cell. However, once Deane enters the bizarre world of Stargher's mind, she finds getting out to be a very difficult matter. The Cell was the first feature from director Tarsem, who previously made award-winning commercials and music videos, including the video for R.E.M.'s "Losing My Religion." The supporting cast includes Catherine Sutherland, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Dylan Baker, and Pruitt Taylor Vince(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: Gruesome thriller starring Christian Bale (Batman) as successful Wall Street broker, Patrick Bateman, as he indulges his penchant for hedonistic living and terrible violence(n)

programme.title: 3 1/2 Minutes, Ten Bullets
programme.desc: A stunning documentary look at the 2012 murder of unarmed black teenager Jordan Davis at a Florida gas station, and the political and social fervor that surrounded the ensuing criminal case. On trial for the murder is white middle-aged Michael Dunn, who shot Davis after taking issue with the loud rap music coming from the car Davis occupied with his friends. Florida's controversial "Stand Your Ground" law is examined in full in this emotional documentary, which has been picked up for distribution by HBO(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: A human and a stork unite to deliver a baby girl to her family. The storks had stopped their baby delivery business since they started working with an e-commerce company in delivering parcels(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: In 1960s South Carolina, a young white girl and her black caregiver are taken in by an eccentric trio of sisters(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Young hustler Charlie Babbitt feels cheated when he is disinherited in favour of his autistic older brother, who he never knew existed. Charlie kidnaps him from the asylum and they head for California, learning much about each other on the way. Hoffman won an Oscar as Best Actor for his role(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: The discovery of marital troubles in her family causes a young woman to question her own upcoming nuptials in this clever romantic comedy. Sarah Jessica Parker stars as Gwyn, a bright, slightly neurotic advertising copywriter who is initially thrilled when her boyfriend Matt (Gil Bellows) finally proposes. Soon afterwards, however, she learns that her mother Nina (Mia Farrow) is indulging in an extra-marital affair with a handsome Latin stud (Antonio Banderas). This is only the first of several shocking revelations, as Gwyn soon learns of infidelity by her father (Paul Mazursky), brother (Kevin Pollack), and even newlywed sister (Carla Gugino). These indiscretions make Gwyn question the validity of the entire institution of marriage and doubt her own future. Director David Frankel, who also penned the screenplay, follows in the footsteps of Woody Allen in using introspective dialogue to detail the romantic troubles of a wealthy, neurotic Jewish family; practiced performances and a colorful use of Miami locations give the film its own personality(n)

programme.title: The Bonfire of the Vanities
programme.desc: An opportunistic Wall Street investor and his golddigger girlfriend find themselves in trouble after a hit-and-run(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Longtime rivals compete for the attentions of a widow, their alluring new neighbour; but they may have to reconcile when their adult children become attracted to one another(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: This Oscar-winning comedy drama stars Matt Damon as a mathematical genius, struggling to come to terms with his talent and the trauma in his life, and Robin Williams as the psychologist trying to help him. Will Hunting is a night janitor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology who hangs out with a tough-talking Irish-American crowd of buddies and hides the fact of his genius like a guilty secret. The secret is discovered by a professor who, when Will is ordered to undergo therapy for his aggression, introduces him to a psychologist who reaches out to the kid, learning much about his own pain in the process(n)

programme.title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius
programme.desc: This animated feature from Nickelodeon is the story of ten-year-old genius inventor Jimmy Neutron, whose penchant for gadget-creation gets him and his robot dog, Goddard, into trouble at home and school. However, when the parents of Jimmy's hometown are kidnapped by the gooey green aliens known as Yokians, it's up to Jimmy, his best friend, Carl Wheezer, and his arch rival, Cindy Vortex, to rally their fellow kids for a rescue effort. Patching together a ragtag armada of interstellar spacecraft, the kid invasion force sets out to rescue the moms and dads who love them and get them home in time for dinner. programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy/ drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing (and the paper's readership). The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

While staying at their family beach house near Seattle, Noah and Emma find a box of things that look like toys, but prove to be far more mysterious. Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. But one day Noah lines up the toys and accidentally activates a powerful force that creates a state-wide blackout. With her family under arrest by the FBI, Emma must make sense of the messages Mimzy, the toy rabbit, has been telepathically communicating to her. programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In this science fiction thriller, child psychiatrist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed a technique that allows her to travel through the minds of her patients. When Stargher (Vincent D'Onofrio), a multiple murderer who methodically drowns his victims and performs bizarre rituals with their bodies, falls into a coma, FBI agent Peter Novak (Vince Vaughn) asks Deane to enter the killer's psyche, in the hope of finding a missing girl whom Stargher has kidnapped; if she's not soon found, in all likelihood she'll die in his torture cell. However, once Deane enters the bizarre world of Stargher's mind, she finds getting out to be a very difficult matter. The Cell was the first feature from director Tarsem, who previously made award-winning commercials and music videos, including the video for R.E.M.'s "Losing My Religion." The supporting cast includes Catherine Sutherland, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Dylan Baker, and Pruitt Taylor Vince(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Part of More4's Indian week, Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

Brian Helgeland's historical sports drama/biopic 42 relates the historic 1947 baseball season in which Brooklyn Dodgers general manager Branch Rickey (Harrison Ford) decides to sign the first black Major League player, Jackie Robinson (Chadwick Boseman). Although Robinson faces ugly, vicious racism from other clubs, fans, and on occasion his own teammates, Rickey encourages him to not fight back. By following that advice, Robinson allows his remarkable athletic talent to speak for itself, and soon the first-year player becomes one the most popular players on the team, eventually securing the Rookie of the Year award. Christopher Meloni and Hamish Linklater co-star(n)

Later, Piers travels to meet Seath's parents in Summerfield, Florida, with their visceral anger standing in stark contrast to Amber's cool demeanour. It soon emerges that Amber was a central player in the plot to kill Seath, but will she take responsibility for her actions?.(n)

programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a garden for a family with twin girls who have a serious, life-limiting condition. Three-year-olds Darcie and Evie Chapman have been diagnosed with Dravet syndrome, a very rare form of epilepsy, and parents Mark and Natalie must be on permanent watch to prevent their daughters' seizures leading to something more serious. The Chapmans' current outdoor space is unsuitable for the girls, with changes of levels, colours of plants and even the light through branches influencing their condition, so the crew follows the rules of a formal garden where straight lines, order and symmetry give an unfussy overall look.(n)

He was last seen embroiled in an argument with a council official about a company preparing to redevelop the site of Blenheim Vale, a disused correctional facility for boys. Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton show her some homes to help make up her mind.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick tends to a Newfoundland called Billy, who clocks up thousands of miles travelling back and forth from his home in Aberdeen for treatment on its legs. He also attempts to help Barney, a Yorkshire terrier that has a deformity in its neck that is compressing its spinal cord. For owners Linda and Barry, Noel is their last chance, but the operation involves high-risk surgery with no guarantee of success.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David Lewis and Giles Beaton kick off the competition at Langland Road in Swansea, where they hope to impress their guests with an ultra-modern approach. Unfortunately, not all the guests can figure out what the hi-tech offerings are. To make matters worse, traditionalists Gordon and Sandra McCallum are more concerned by cobwebs and dust.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ruth and Margaret Dugdall welcome their rivals to Castle Lodge Hotel in Felixstowe, Suffolk. Ed Prophet plays a series of tricks on Gordon McCallum in the hope of making him smile, but previous hosts David Lewis and Giles Beaton are unimpressed when the prankster takes on the role of waiter.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gordon and Sandra McCallum host at Bryn Woodlands House in Colwyn Bay, Conwy, where they take the group harness racing. Ed Prophet worries about getting manure on his face, and later receives a shock. Margaret and Ruth Dugdall think the B&B's decor is poor, and Giles Beaton has a problem with a bottle of ketchup.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Edward Prophet and fiancee Rachel Pickup play host at the Tollemache Arms in Cheshire as the week's competition enters the final round. The couple pull out all the stops to charm their guests, but their efforts are undermined by a shambolic breakfast service.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the contestants prepare to discover which of their establishments has won the competition, the owners of Langland Road are shocked by a peculiar payment, and begin to suspect something is amiss. The Castle Lodge hoteliers are dismayed when criticism is directed towards their new wallpaper, and the proprietors of Bryn Woodland House struggle to face up to their shortcomings.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are currently renting because they have sold their home. While Jeanette is quite certain she would like to settle in Cornwall, Bob has got itchy feet and wants to move to southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a married couple decide where to spend their retirement. Gail wants to return to her roots and move to the west coast of Scotland, but Clive is craving some sun and likes the look of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Hunstrete, Somerset: Keeping Up with the Georgians.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team descend on a field outside Bath to search for the remains of the Georgian house built 200 years previously by local MP Francis Popham. A set of stone arches is all that remains of the property, but two oil paintings suggest it was once one of the grandest homes in Britain - although the results of the dig tell a very different story.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Coberley, Gloucestershire: Mysteries of the Mosaic.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to a Cotswolds field, where they suspect the great and the good of Roman Britain once built their homes. However, an extensive dig reveals that the site was once a hub of worship for Bacchus, the pagan god of wine and entertainment, and its destruction was a result of iconoclasm practised by early Roman Christians.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend fix up a historic racing car, an Austin Healey Sprite, which has been kept in a garage since 1968. The challenge is to restore the car so that Sir Stirling Moss, who raced in the vehicle at Sebring in the USA in 1962, can get back behind the wheel.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a prefabricated-home project in west Cumbria to find out whether Alan and Judith Dawson are happy with the finished product. The couple employed a method of building that allowed them to assemble the property in just 15 days on a budget of £300,000, but with so much attention given to the speed of construction, there was little time to think how the house might be to live in.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: New series. Period drama telling the story of a Second World War nurse who is mysteriously transported back to 1743 Scotland as she travels back from the battlefields with her husband. In the opening episode, Claire Randall finds herself at the mercy of a British soldier before being kidnapped by a group of Highlanders whose ranks include an injured man named Jamie, Starring Caitriona Balfe, Gary Lewis and Tobias Menzies.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This one-off edition of the programme looks at the challenges facing Cheshire's police custody teams, with around 20,000 people passing through their cells every year. Homeless ex-serviceman and repeat offender Michael has been arrested following a complaint about his behaviour in a cinema, but he is just happy to have a roof over his head for the night, while DC Ben Hilton is called out to deal with a case of a woman who has been arrested after stabbing her partner in the leg with a kitchen knife.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A busy night shift sees a series of men admitted with various problems. Father-of-six Stacey is experiencing breathing difficulties, but his demanding attitude appears to mask a vulnerability. Twenty-year-old Sam is brought in after being attacked outside a nightclub and has possible injuries to the neck and spine. He is nervous because his father died at the hospital and, with a broken nose, is worried he may have lost his looks. Henry has an electrician's exam the following morning but has been hiccuping for three days. Registrar Faheem is determined to diagnose the problem and get him well in time.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London. A doctor is shocked when a young woman arrives in resus with life-threatening swelling on her brain following a random attack by a stranger on the streets, while a mother faces an agonising wait as tests are carried out on her 12-year-old son, who was hit by a car and airlifted to King's by emergency medics. A 90-year-old former circus performer is also in A&E after collapsing at home, and news of his colourful past quickly circulates among the staff.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: New series. Period drama telling the story of a Second World War nurse who is mysteriously transported back to 1743 Scotland as she travels back from the battlefields with her husband. In the opening episode, Claire Randall finds herself at the mercy of a British soldier before being kidnapped by a group of Highlanders whose ranks include an injured man named Jamie, Starring Caitriona Balfe, Gary Lewis and Tobias Menzies.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a prefabricated-home project in west Cumbria to find out whether Alan and Judith Dawson are happy with the finished product. The couple employed a method of building that allowed them to assemble the property in just 15 days on a budget of £300,000, but with so much attention given to the speed of construction, there was little time to think how the house might be to live in.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are currently renting because they have sold their home. While Jeanette is quite certain she would like to settle in Cornwall, Bob has got itchy feet and wants to move to southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ben Turner invites fellow hoteliers to Taylor's Farm Retreat in Surrey in the first round of the hospitality contest. However, the guests are surprised to discover his rural B&B is home to one of Europe's biggest pole-dancing studios. Ben also treats his rivals to a horse-drawn carriage trip to his favourite country pub, but as the contestants start to size up their competitors, tensions begin to rise.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest moves to the G! Boutique in Southsea, Hampshire, owned by Eli Gray and partner Jason Bawa. On arrival the guests are pleasantly surprised by the upmarket decor, but two competitors search for faults, which upsets one of their hosts considerably.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gill Borg Fenech, owner of the Amber Guest House in Cleethorpes, North East Lincolnshire, takes part in this week's challenge, but the lack of en-suites is not to everyone's liking. Over dinner Gill reveals a secret that leaves some of her guests sympathetic, while others are unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Graham Roe and Terry Stewart, the experienced owners of the Knife and Cleaver in Bedfordshire, take part in the final round of the week's competition. After a smooth evening of polite talk and compliments, things get nasty at breakfast time when the guests complain about the standard of food.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. But tensions mount when Ben Turner's hosting and cleanliness standards are discussed before the week's winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Serial renovators Lynn and Kerry cannot decide between starting a new project in the Chelmsford area where they currently live, or building a snorkelling business in Majorca, Spain. Sara Damergi and Jasmine Harman try to help them make a decision as they view properties in both regions.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps a couple who have been living abroad choose between properties in Oxford or Javea, in Spain. Steve hopes to settle back in his native Britain where his French wife Caroline can indulge in her love of culture, but she has her sights set on the Costa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Padstow, Cornwall: From Constantinople to Cornwall.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Padstow, Cornwall, to investigate why 1,500-year-old pottery and metalwork originating in North Africa and Turkey have been discovered by locals. The geophysics results suggest the field in which they were found may have contained an Iron Age village, while the archaeologists suspect the nearby sandy cove may have been a port dealing with traders from throughout the Mediterranean.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Dungannon, Northern Ireland: Fort of the Earls.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Dungannon, Northern Ireland, to investigate a former 17th-century stronghold. Seized in 1602 by English forces, the site is now the location of an abandoned British Army base. With only one picture of the old fortress still in existence, the crew struggles to uncover the truth about this important site.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Northumberland to restore a real `barn find'; a 1934 Morgan F4 three-wheeler, which has been stored in a shed for more than 50 years. The vehicle was one of the most successful lightweight cars from the early days of motoring.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick fears the worst when a young cockapoo is hit by a lawnmower, and he faces the challenge of saving as much of its leg as possible. Meanwhile, a seven-year-old labrador struggles with pain in its elbows, and a German Shepherd-Collie cross is suffering with a bulging disk in his spin and hip dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Denise and Bruno Del Tufo in Ashford, Kent, who hoped to transform a concrete water tower designed by Edwin Lutyens into a contemporary home. Kevin was originally far from enthusiastic about their project, believing the original building to be ugly and brutal in its design - but the couple soon had other problems to worry about, as rising steel prices forced them to make drastic changes to their budget.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighty-year-old Rose has fluid on her lungs and is having trouble breathing. Her daughters Christine, Sandra and Debbie put on brave faces around her bedside, convincing her that everything will be all right, but in the relatives' room there's high emotion as they contemplate life without their mother. Also in resus at King's College Hospital is Kevin, a 55-year-old trucker who has sustained injuries in a road accident.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 39-year-old man is flown to London's King's College Hospital after being involved in a head-on collision while driving a friend's sports car, and doctors fear his injuries could leave him paralysed. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Thomassine requires treatment following a skateboarding accident and the staff see to Matias, 34, who has been dragged along a station platform by a moving train.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Loved Sitcoms
programme.desc: Documentary, celebrating some of the many classic sitcoms that have entertained British audiences over the past 50 years, narrated by Tamsin Greig, herself a star of the likes of Friday Night Dinner and Black Books. Along the way, she takes in everything from modern `game-changers' such as The Office, Twenty Twelve and Peep Show, to vintage shows including The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son. Making use of a cross-generational poll, she presents a countdown that reveals which show has become the most revered sitcom of all, and a host of stars including Mrs Brown's Boys' Brendan O'Carroll, One Foot in the Grave's Richard Wilson, Blackadder's Tony Robinson and Keeping Up Appearances' Patricia Routledge share their thoughts on working on some of the nation's most treasured comedy dramas.(n)

programme.title: Lockdown
programme.desc: San Antonio Gang War. San Antonio, Texas has one of the highest crime rates of any large city in the US - and a sprawling jail to contain all the accused lawbreakers. Called Bexar County Adult Detention Center, the jail houses nearly 4000 inmates on any given day, most awaiting trial or sentencing, many of them accused of serious felonies. A 900-person staff works to keep things safe and orderly. But they're not always successful(n)

programme.title: Lockdown

programme.title: Lockdown
programme.desc: Sex Offenders. Despised by the outside world, sex offenders often face even tougher critics once imprisoned: their fellow inmates. At Fremont Correctional Facility in Colorado, more than 1,400 sex offenders are held in a crowded, hostile environment where they must battle their internal and external demons. This episode grants viewers the rare opportunity to see child molesters and rapists talk openly about their crimes, their experiences behind bars and the facility's intensive therapy program(n)

programme.title: 20 Animals That Will Kill You
programme.desc: Wild animals kill thousands of people every day - and the most dangerous creatures may not be what you think. From Bengal tigers to elephants to mosquitos, animals can kill in a multitude of ways. Predators are obvious killers, but others defend their territory, attack in self-defense, or kill by sheer accident. Wildlife experts break down some of the most revealing attacks caught on tape to expose what animals kill the most people, how they kill, and why(n)

programme.desc: Germany v Mexico (Kick-off 7.00pm). Coverage of the second semi-final from Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, Russia. Both of the teams progressed to the last four having won two and drawn one of their group-stage matches, and while that record was good enough for Germany to finish at the top of Group B, Mexico had to settle for second place behind Portugal in Group A, owing to their inferior goal difference. Together, this evil pairing have set their sights on stealing a multimillion dollar painting - can the super-fast hero possibly win against the forces of fire and ice? He has his reservations, especially after what happened during his last face-off with his old friend - but when a loved one is kidnapped, he quickly races to the rescue. Grant Gustin stars, with guest appearances by former Prison Break actors Wentworth Miller and Dominic Purcell.(n)

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: The fantasy adventure returns after a nine-week break. There's a new bad guy in town - Mark Sheffer, known to his enemies as Shrapnel - who has set off a string of bombs across the city. Sharp-shooting socialite-cum-superhero Oliver has the unenviable task of bringing him down before he hits his latest target, so he enlists the help of Felicity and Diggle. Meanwhile, Thea sees a different side to Roy and Laurel's suspicions about Sebastian continue to grow.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross investigates the drug epidemic sweeping through Rio de Janeiro. Brazil has the seventh largest economy in the world but despite this new-found wealth it is the largest consumer of crack cocaine anywhere on the planet. Ross witnesses dealers, for whom selling crack is a 24-hour operation and who openly carry weapons in case police mount a raid. In the dens he discovers the human tragedy of the crisis, meeting those trapped in a cycle of addiction, slaves to a drug that destroys jobs, relationships and lives.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: Comedian Rob Beckett, former Olympic heptathlon champion Denise Lewis and boxer James DeGale join captains Jamie Redknapp and Andrew Flintoff and regular panellist Jack Whitehall on the sports-based comedy quiz. James Corden asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: In this edition the actor explores the luxury hotels of Hong Kong. Home to more skyscrapers than any other city, he first checks in to the Mandarin in the financial district, before experiencing the Four Seasons, the only hotel with two Michelin three-star resturants, as well as the timeless Peninsula in Kowloon, which even provides a Rolls-Royce airport taxi service. He ends his stay at the Ritz-Carlton, home to the world's highest swimming pool.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor explores Berlin, visiting the arty Propeller Island City Lodge - a hotel where guests can fulfil their fantasies by sleeping in lion cages, coffins or rotating beds. At the Schlosshotel in affluent Grunewald, cabaret dancer Romy Haag talks to Richard about her affair with David Bowie, who stayed at the hotel while living in the German capital in the 1970s.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores Newcastle, discovering strange sounds by the river and finding out how traditional culture is being reinterpreted in the Byker district. He goes behind the scenes at Newcastle United with local football hero Peter Beardsley, learns about the history of adult comic Viz from former editor Simon Donald and accompanies comedienne Sarah Millican to her favourite part of the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming heads across the Irish Sea to Dublin, where he succumbs to the city's famous charm and meets some of its most fascinating characters. On a journey that takes in an 18th-century pleasure house and a burlesque life-painting class, Alan also stops off in Temple Bar for a pint with singer Sharon Corr, unlocks a mystery in Ireland's oldest library and uncovers a stylish secret that lurks behind the steel shutters of an old lock-up.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Josh determines to make sure a foreign aid bill passes even though it's a hopeless cause. Charlie unwittingly gets in over his head with the Department of Defence and Danny continues to pursue the Shareef matter. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: CJ reluctantly returns to Dayton, Ohio, to give a speech at her high-school reunion, where she learns her father is rapidly deteriorating from Alzheimer's disease. Back at the White House, Toby struggles with the press secretary's briefings while she is away. Matthew Modine guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A TV reporter disappears during an investigation into a nightclub owner suspected of drug dealing. Jack and the team discover a connection with a murderer on death row and the assistant district attorney assigned to the case.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom, Greg and Warrick investigate the death of a psychic who was shot in her occult shop. The ransacked store and empty till point to a robbery, but the money seems to have been taken by a delivery boy who has an alibi for the night in question. However, the post-mortem reveals a fatal plant extract in the body, forcing the team to the conclusion the death was premeditated murder - with several suspects.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Despite not having jurisdiction, Frank intervenes when diplomatic immunity complicates a child abuse case for Danny and Baez.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part one of two. Conflict in an otherwise inconsequential country forces President Bartlet to rewrite his inaugural address, tensions mount between the White House and the Pentagon, and staff are stunned by a betrayal within their own ranks. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Allison Janney.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part two of two. Preparations for the Presidential inauguration continue as Charlie hunts desperately for a suitable Bible and the White House edges closer toward military action. Meanwhile, President Bartlet appoints a new deputy communications director, and Toby discovers a kindred spirit in Will Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for a missing schoolteacher and uncovers contradictory information about his background - including evidence that he might have been supplementing his income by selling drugs, despite being wealthy to begin with. Christopher Gorham (Ugly Betty) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom and Stokes are called in to investigate the fatal shooting of three teenagers, and discover they were murdered while putting up posters to promote hip-hop star Dollar - who is later found bound and gagged in the boot of his car. programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: CJ reluctantly returns to Dayton, Ohio, to give a speech at her high-school reunion, where she learns her father is rapidly deteriorating from Alzheimer's disease. programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to New Orleans and meets soul singer Irma Thomas at the Hotel de Monteleone, an establishment that was popular with writers such as Tennessee Williams, F Scott Fitzgerald and Ernest Hemingway. Richard speaks to Steel Magnolias author Robert Harling about the Soniat House, check into the supposedly haunted Hotel Maison de Ville and talks to burlesque dancer Chrissy Owens at the Roosevelt.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to Tokyo and checks out the Park Hyatt, the hotel featured in the film Lost in Translation, and goes behind the closed doors of the Japanese capital's love hotels. In the fashionable district of Meguro, Richard takes in the Claska, which was the city's first boutique hotel and has its own canine beauty salon.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Glasgow, one of his favourite cities, to reveal unusual and often hidden sights and sounds overlooked by the public. programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Town
programme.desc: A bad-tempered dentist has a near-death experience and finds himself able to see ghosts. He is irritated to find that all the spirits need him to sort out their unresolved problems from when they were alive, particularly a man who wants the grouchy dentist to stop his widow from remarrying. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais, Greg Kinnear and Tea Leoni.(n)

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Four friends stuck in a rut decide to celebrate one of their birthdays in style, but it isn't long before things spiral out of control. Comedy, starring Grace Helbig, Mamrie Hart and Hannah Hart.(n)

programme.title: Dope
programme.desc: A geeky teenager in an inner-city neighbourhood harbours dreams of going to Harvard. He and his friends think their social standing at school is set to improve when they get an invitation to an underground party, but the night leaves them mixed up in crime and drugs and forced to grow up fast. Crime comedy, starring Shameik Moore and Tony Revolori.(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo
programme.desc: A lowly fish-tank cleaner working at a gigolo's luxurious house has his eyes opened to a completely new way of life - but an accident with his employer's prized pets puts him into a tricky situation. Desperate to raise a quick buck, he is soon entertaining a series of increasingly sex-crazed women. Comedy, starring Rob Schneider, William Forsythe, Eddie Griffin, Oded Fehr and Gail O'Grady.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
programme.desc: A singer is transformed from naive country boy to the greatest rock 'n' roll legend of all time - with the traditional stand-bys of sex, drugs, failed marriages, falls from grace, spectacular comebacks and the love of a good woman along the way. Comedy spoof of music biopics, starring John C Reilly, Jenna Fischer and Raymond J Barry, and featuring appearances from Jack Black and Jack White.(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Family man Rusty Griswold spent his childhood family holidays stumbling from one disaster to another with his hapless father. He is determined that his own road trip with his wife and kids will go better - but soon finds the apple has not fallen far from the tree. Sequel to the 1980s comedy series, starring Ed Helms and Christina Applegate, with Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo reprising their roles.(n)

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: Two college graduates faced with the prospect of deciding what to do with their lives find themselves faced with a more immediate crisis - getting and keeping a job. Their search for employment takes them through a succession of strange experiences and even stranger workplaces. Comedy, starring Miles Teller, Anna Kendrick, Bryan Cranston and Alison Brie.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo
programme.desc: A lowly fish-tank cleaner working at a gigolo's luxurious house has his eyes opened to a completely new way of life - but an accident with his employer's prized pets puts him into a tricky situation. Desperate to raise a quick buck, he is soon entertaining a series of increasingly sex-crazed women. Comedy, starring Rob Schneider, William Forsythe, Eddie Griffin, Oded Fehr and Gail O'Grady.(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo
programme.desc: A low-rent lover-for-hire tries to raise the money needed for legal fees when his old friend and former manager lands himself in trouble with the authorities in Amsterdam. Unfortunately, a workers' union of gigolos is less than happy about his arrival in Europe. Comedy sequel, starring Rob Schneider, Eddie Griffin, Jeroen Krabbe and Oded Fehr.(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Aliens declare war on Earth having seen video games from the 1980s and interpreted them as a threat. Their attack comes in the form of deadly recreations of classic video games, so the US government recruits four former arcade champions to repel the attack. Sci-fi comedy, starring Adam Sandler and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.(n)

programme.title: What About Bob
programme.desc: A psychiatrist takes on a friend's client, who turns out to be a well-meaning but annoying neurotic barely able to leave his home. The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword - Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits the set of Guy Ritchie and Jude Law's epic action adventure to see what it takes to bring King Arthur to life.(n)

programme.title: Year One
programme.desc: An inept hunter and his shy gatherer sidekick are kicked out of their tribe and left to wander the Old Testament world. Blundering through several key moments of the Bible, they eventually end up at Sodom, where they must try and rescue their people from slavery. Comedy, starring Jack Black, Michael Cera, Oliver Platt and Hank Azaria.(n)

programme.title: Bruce Almighty
programme.desc: God tires of a down-on-his-luck reporter's constant complaining, so passes on His powers to give him a taste of ultimate responsibility. The newsman falls in love with his extraordinary abilities - but a never-ending stream of incoming prayers and his ambitious attempt to please everyone soon prove there is more to the job than meets the eye. Comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Jennifer Aniston and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: The heroic outlaw returns from the Crusades to discover the country is in the grip of evil Prince John and the Sheriff of Rottingham, so he unites a motley band of warriors to overthrow them. Mel Brooks comedy, starring Cary Elwes, Roger Rees, Richard Lewis, Tracey Ullman, Amy Yasbeck, Patrick Stewart, Isaac Hayes and Dom DeLuise.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie
programme.desc: The indomitable Irish matriarch discovers that a plan is afoot by developers to buy the famous Dublin street market where her family has run a fruit and veg stall for generations. Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie
